shortdescription: NEPAL: TRAVAIL DIGNE ET PROTECTION SOCIALE
projecttitle: Nepal: travail digne et protection sociale
longdescription: WSM est l'ONg issue du mouvement ouvrier chr?tien(MOC) et  du Christelijke Arbeidersbeweging (ACW). C'est une ONG bilingue regroupant en son sein diff?rentes organisations sociales : la Conf?d?ration des Syndicats Chr?tiens CSC, l?Alliance Nationale des Mutualit?s Chr?tiennes, Vie F?minine, les Equipes Populaires, la Jeunesse Ouvri?re Chr?tienne, le Groupe ARCO, vakbond ACV, mutualiteit LCM, socioculturele verenigingen KWB en Vakantiegenoegens, vrouwenbeweging KAV, ouderenbeweging OKRA trefpunt 55+, jongerenorganisatie KAJ, thuiszorgdienst Familiehulp, co?peratieve holding Groep Arco. Solidarit? Mondiale a pour ambition de renforcer les mouvements sociaux dans le Sud pour qu?ils soient des acteurs de changement et des agents de d?veloppement en faveur des populations locales.Elle s'est fix?e comme mission principale les th?matiques relatives au Droits du travail et ? la  protection sociale.  Nord: les membres des diff?rentes organisations constitutivesSud: les membres et affili?s des organisations partenaires  Promouvoir ensemble avec les mouvements sociaux le travail digne et la protection sociale pour lutter contre la pauvret? et l'exclusion sociale  NORDOS1:Onze ruime achterban ziet in dat menswaardig werk en sociale bescherming instrumenten zijn om armoede duurzaam te bestrijden in het Zuiden en engageren zich daarrondOS 2 :De Christelijke Arbeidersbeweging en haar deelorganisaties versterken en vergroten hun inzet voor menswaardig werk en sociale bescherming in het ZuidenOS 3 :Le public des organisations constitutives (OC) du MOC svoit dans le travail d?cent et de la protection sociale des leviers de lutte durable contre la pauvret? et s engage pour un d?veloppement bas? sur ces m?canismesOS 4 :Le MOC et ses organisations constitutives renforcent leur engagement pour la dimension internationale en g?n?ral et pour le travail d?cent et la protection sociale dans le Sud en particulier et le traduisent dans leur action de mouvementOS 5 : Door beleidsbe?nvloeding komen menswaardig werk en sociale bescherming in het Zuiden, op de politieke agendaOS 6:De acties van het Vlaamse Schone Klerenplatform zijn geco?rdineerd en dragen bij tot een verbetering van arbeidsomstandigheden in de kledingsectorSUD

shortdescription: APPUI ? L'?LIMINATION DE LA LEISHMANIOSE VISC?RALE
projecttitle: Appui ? l'?limination de la Leishmaniose visc?rale
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
channelreportedname: ITM Institute for Tropical Medicine ANTWERPEN - ANVERS
longdescription: Projet d'appui ? l'?limination de la Leishmaniose visc?rale dans le sous-continent Indien  (Inde, Nepal, Bangladesh) avec centre ? Phnom Penh    In order of impact and level:(1) The leaders, scientists and experts in the partner institutions in developing countries;(2) The health professionals and policy makers that can implement the improved practicesand policies resulting from the programme;(3) The communities and individuals that should benefit from the improved practices andpolicies.  To strengthen the rational basis and the country ownership of (human and animal) healthcare systems and policies in developing countries, in order to improve the health status ofthe populations and thereby to contribute to the reduction of poverty and inequity.  To support a regional centre of excellence in support of the VisceralLeishmaniasis elimination initiative in India, Bangladesh and Nepal. The core activitieswill be to accumulate and translate the evidence for improved VL control policy including themonitoring of drug effectiveness in the region.  Result 1 Capacities in the partner institutes have been strengthened and networkingconsolidatedResult 2. Reference laboratory for monitoring in vitro drug susceptibility of L. donovaniestablishedResult 3. Evidence on the effectiveness of VL case management is availableResult 4. Evidence on treatment effectiveness translated into policy and practice

longdescription: ''L'h?pital mobile a pour but d?apporter une m?decine de qualit? dans les r?gions montagneuses et recul?es. Des m?decins g?n?ralistes et sp?cialistes traiteront des patients atteints de maladies diverses, m?dicales ou chirurgicales.Une unit? mobile pourrait ainsi se d?placer 12 fois 15 jours par an. Les soins seront bien s?r gratuits pour cette population pauvre. Il est ?vident que cela n?cessite une bonne organisation (m?decins, infirmi?res, techniciens m?dicaux, administration, ?) et une bonne logistique (?quipement m?dical, ?quipement de terrain, transport,?). Ce n?est qu?? cette condition qu?une efficacit? r?elle pourra ?tre atteinte et que, par la suite, ce type d?unit? pourrait ?tre multipli?.''

longdescription: AVOCATS SANS FRONTIERES      Ce projet est la suite du projet initi? par ASF en 2007 ''Acc?s ? la justice et lutte contre l'impunit? au N?pal'' (150.000? re?us). Le projet a pour but de favoriser et am?liorer l'acc?s ? la justice pour les groupes les plus vuln?rables au N?pal (population pauvre, minorit?s, femmes, jeunesse) notamment en renfor?ant la visibilit? et l?action des barreaux (par ex. avocats pro deo).  Par ce projet, ASF soutient la construction et le renforcement du syst?me judiciaire et de l'Etat de droit au N?pal de m?me qu'il vise ? conscientiser les acteurs du syst?me judiciaire au respect des droits de l'homme.

shortdescription: INTEGRATED PROGRAM OF PREVENTION AND TREATMENT OF DISABILITY IN THE LUMBINI - NEPAL. 2ND YEAR
projecttitle: Integrated program of prevention and treatment of disability in the Lumbini - Nepal. 2nd year
geography: area di Lumbini: Nawalparasi, Rupandehi e Kapilvastu
longdescription: The objective of the project is the contribution to the development of a program of prevention and treatment of disabilities in the administrative area of Lumbini. The planned activities are: awareness actions and meetings with the population in ten communities, data collection on people with disabilities, training for medical and paramedical staff of the health centers, organization of community groups of disabled people and their families, women's groups and monitoring of groups organized in the previous annuity; training courses in the field of social participation, civil and constitutional rights. The project aims to continuing the process of organizing a physiotherapeutic and social assistance pediatric centre, able to support people with disabilities and, in particular, for women and mothers with children with disabilities.

shortdescription: PROMOTION OF FISH FARMING IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Promotion of fish farming in Nepal
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
longdescription: Preparatory Phase for a foreseen Main Programme regarding fish farming.The goal of the Preparatory Phase is to pave the way for increased fish farming production in rural hill areas in Nepal.The purpose of the Preparatory Project is i) to prepare a fish farming programme (Main Programme) in the order of 4 years and a budget in the order of approximately NOK 20 million and ii) to achieve increased knowledge on reproductive life of indigenous carp fish in Nepal before the Main Programme starts.There is a need to improve the present draft Programme Document before the Main Programme starts.Note that there has been a previous phase (2006/2007) NPL-06/002. Addendum NPL07/020. (2 addendums)04.11.2011 (inhv): Addendum 103.11.2011 (inhv): Signed Addendum

shortdescription: MUSIC COLLABORATION THROUGH NEPAL MUSIC CENTER - EXIT PHASE
projecttitle: Music collaboration through Nepal Music Center - exit phase
longdescription: NMC has been supported by the Embassy since 2005, and has applied for a new programme period 2010-2012.  Due to budget constraints, the Embassy will provide funds for 2010- 2011, with the intention to support in 2012 as well. During the process NMC has in dialogue with the Embassy worked on the program for the project to integrate the new The project period will be considered a phasing out period for the Norwegian support, and during the period NMC will in close co-operation with the Embassy develop a sound exit strategy. The Embassy considers it important to continue the support for NMC during this period to ensure our efforts and funds will not be lost, and to make sure NMC will be a sustainable institution. The overall goal for the institution is to strengthen and preserve the musical heritage of Nepal; the purpose of the programme is to establish an institution that offers all encompassing curricula for generating pedagogical interest in folk/ ethnic Nepali music.

longdescription: Saferworld has recently, with the Embassys support, completed research on the different needs and priorities of men and women qualified/eligible Maoist Army combatants for rehabilitation back into society and integration into security agencies. The research also focused on the views of communities on rehabilitation and integration and in particular how these differ by and towards men and women. Recommendations for strengthening the gender sensitivity of security agencies emerging from the research and suggestions made by different target groups included the need to raise public awareness on the positive and necessary role women can play in the delivery of security. The goal of the project is to strengthen effectiveness and gender sensitivity of policy and programming on integration and rehabilitation which in turn, will contribute to the promotion of a gender-sensitive integration and peace process and the implementation of recently agreed National Action Plan on United Nations Security Council Resolution (UNSCR) 1325.  Objective: To raise awareness of the public and security agency personnel on the positive and necessary role women can play in the delivery of security and in secu

Activities: TIN will arrange and facilitate a workshop with stakeholders from civil society in Nepal, where one can discuss the current situation on corruption, and possible solutions. The topic will be  Political integrity and anti- corruption . Projected number of participants is 35 to 50, and the workshop will last around three hours. The workshop is to take place on 30th of August. The workshop will be held in nepali, but TIN will provide a written report in English. Follow- up after the Anti- Corruption Study.  What  are the next steps? What are the implications of the findings? How can we use the findings in a practical matter? The outcome of this study might identify additional needs or studies to be undertaken to complement or possibly strengthen the finding of the study. This could be a need for further in-depth studies or a need to explore additional  areas that could be interesting in further elaborating the anti-corruption approach in Nepal. Thus TIN could be asked to assist in commissioning  these types of  studies to ensure  a more complete  picture for GoN and donors to analyze. These studies could include field trips and reporting. shortdescription: MULTI DONOR TRUST FUND FOR PUBLIC FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT (WB)
projecttitle: Multi Donor Trust Fund for Public Financial Management (WB)
longdescription: The background for  Norways interest in this agreement is as follows:  - Continuing reports of financial indiscipline and lack of compliance with existing financial requirements are indicators of deteriorating PFM performance and fiduciary control at the country level in the management of public finances and resources.  - The FM performance in Bank operations is showing signs of decline with a trend towards more  unsatisfactory  FM performance and less  satisfactory  FM performance.  - Possible causes of declining performance - political instability and vested interests being at the center - declining accounting and auditing capacity, increasing financial indiscipline, weak internal audit and conflict of interest, slower decision making, reluctance to recruit international expert consultants, no Auditor General appointed for > 3 years and limited PAC directives follow up, lack of executive response and no sanctions and rewards.Possible ways of responding - short-term measures such as, special purpose reviews and capacity building; and medium-term measures including developing and strengthening PFM institutions, systems and procedures, capacity building and developing social

Background: Development cooperation in support of energy is one of the three priority areas for Norways development cooperation with Nepal. Nepals hydro power potential can contribute significantly to economic development, among others enabling the government to provide health, education and other socially inclusive welfare services. Hence, there are clear synergies between energy and the Embassys other priority thematic areas as well as cross-cutting issues as gender equality and social inclusion. Hydro power development is also important in a regional climate context. Despite the recognition that Nepal depends on private investments to utilize its hydro power potential, national and foreign hydro power developers, including Norwegian companies, are not actively backed by the government and public opinion when it comes to the development of specific projects. This is partly due to institutional capacity issues but also to the fact that foreign investments in the hydro power sector is a sensitive issue. On a local level revenue-sharing is a conflict issue.In this context more systematic dialogue and networking with strategic Nepalese energy actors and other donors seems

Objectives:Improved human rights situation of gender and sexual minoritiesImproved (public) media coverage of LGBTI agenda and actions Increased access to resources (including skills/knowledge) for overall development of LGBTIs RNE has chosen to focus the support in these three areas for the following reasons:-Core support will enable BDS to focus on the planned activities while developing as an organization. This will also help BDS not to be too donor focused for funding opportunities.-The Human Rights option is chosen because it is high on the agenda of the Norwegian government and RNEs development cooperation with Nepal, including a named priority for the promotion of rights of sexual and gender minor

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: The Board of Ministers on 1 December 2009 the Nepal Peace Trust Fund (NPTF), originally agreed upon for a three year period until 18 January 2010 only, has been extended for another three-year term until 17 January 2013. The NPTF derives its mandate from the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) and other relevant peace agreements. The NPTF (a) functions as a coordinating body for peace related initiatives, (b) acts as a funding mechanism for The Government of Nepal (GoN) and donor resources, and (c) monitors the peace process. NPTF is Nepals own mechanism for support to peace building activities. It is managed by the Ministry of Peace and Reconstruction and GoN is contributing with more than 50 % of the funds. This makes NPTF an important tool to help build Nepalese ownership to the peace process. In spite of the unstable political situation over the last years, including shifting governments, the NPTF has been able to remain relevant and to support important functions in the peace process, for example financing the elections in 2008, the allowances for the Maoist soldiers as well as the maintenance of basic infrastructure in the Maoist cantonments. longdescription: Support to activities initiated and/or supported by the peace support working group for UN Resolution 1325 on Women, Peace and Security. Norway is chair of the group which consists of UN agencies in Nepal and bilateral donors. The PSWG has as its main task, according to its TOR,  to enhance cooperation and coordination among UN agencies and donors . Key topics that emerge for consideration are: representation of women in government structures and in peace Commissions; reintegration and other support to women associated with armed conflict and their dependents; support for local womens peace initiatives; and security sector reform. Activities include cooperation and coordination, sharing of information and analysis, and advocacy. Relevant follow-up work related to UN Resolution 1820 will also be undertaken.

purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: Development cooperation in support of good governance is one of the three focus and priority areas for Norways development cooperation with Nepal. Governance support includes both political and economic dimensions, public financial management issues as well support for democracy and the implementation of the peace process. The governance challenges in Nepal are very substantial, including a high and increasing level of corruption at all levels of society.The complex nature of governance support in Nepal implies that there is a considerable need for analytical support to the Embassy and competence enhancement among embassy staff to enable the necessary quality assurance of Norways support for good governance in Nepal.The project has the following objective:Objective: To strengthen the quality assurance of Norways governance support through analytical and technical support and competence building.

shortdescription: SANKALPA - EMPOWERMENT OF WOMEN FOR POLITICAL AND SOCIAL JUSTICE
projecttitle: Sankalpa - Empowerment of Women for Political and Social Justice
longdescription: The goal of the project is to help increase and enhance women representation and rights in the government, political parties, private sectors, at all levels, and ensure that conflict affected women have access to social justice. This will be done through capacity building of various women leaders at grass roots level and women parliamentarians: advocacy and awareness raising on womens representation; Capacity building to national leaders and grass roots women activists on NAP and transitional justice; and through strengthening Sankalpa as an organization by appraising and restructuring its systems and procedures. The primary target groups are thus the district and village level women, key women activists and womens rights organization leaders and Women Human Rights Defenders (WHRDs), conflict affected women and parliamentarians. Civil servants, central level political leaders, local journalists, rural population and CA committee members are the secondary target groups.Purpose: support the implementation of the National Action Plan of UNSCR 1325 and 1820; and increase representation of women in political parties, civil service and national and sub-national governance structures.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO THE CONSTITUTION ASSEMBLY  ELECTION , ADDENDUM
projecttitle: Support to the Constitution Assembly  Election , addendum
longdescription: This project is related to the overall support to the Nepali peace process, with the aim to contribute to the conductions of free and fair elections to a constituent assembly, according to the Comprehensive Peace Agreement. The support is mainly provided to the Election Commission, in close cooperation with UNMIN and UNDP electoral teams.Developing guidelines for the preparation of candidate lists for Constitutional Assembly on the basis of quota requirements including specific guidance for political parties on how they can meet these requirements. Briefing political parties on the implementation of the quota requirement. Developing of procedures for and assisting the Election Commision (EC) in reviewing the parties candidate lists.  Assisting the EC during the calculation and announcement of results including in the scrutiny of candidates selected by the political parties against the quota requirementThis is an extension of NPL 07/032, as the elections were postponed in 2007. NPL 08/001 constitutes the addendum to NPL 07/032.

purposename: Plant and post-harvest protection and pest control
longdescription: The programme is expected to contribute to increased productivity in agriculture while at the same time contributing to a reduction in the use of pesticides and improvements in the environment. The programme is also expected to contribute to increasing the awareness among farmers about the links between inputs, farming systems and production output. The focus is primarily on rice cultivation, but also horticulture and vegetable production are targeted. The field level training will be conducted through Farmer Field Schools (FFS), and includes training of trainers, preparation of extension materials and support to farmers organisations. These activities are expected to contribute to empowerment of farmers and communities. The programme will be operational throughout the country. The Goal of the Programme is to contribute to sustainable broad-based poverty alleviation and food security while contributing to human healt and environmental protection.The objectives of the Programme are:(i) to contribute to institutionalise a sustainable national Integrated Pest Management Programme (IPM) in Nepal by strengthening the capacity of the Plant Protection Directorate (PPD), collab

projecttitle: Peace Corps, FK Norway, personnel exchange
longdescription: Sharing knowledge on technologies and implementation strategies for sustainable energy services for households.

longdescription: The project is based on a 5-year Memo of Understanding with the cooperating Supreme Audit Institution (SAI). Main objective is good governance and anti-corruption. Dialogue on broad basis between the two SAIs.

purposename: Removal of land mines and explosive remnants of war
channelname: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS

longdescription: Switzerland is recognizing the importance of high quality vegetable seed production through the promotion of private-public partnership among producer cooperatives, NGOs and private seed entrepreneurs in the seed sector. Producing seeds through farmers groups and cooperatives has been a successful approach, which allows a sustainable national seed production. The goal of VSP-III is  to have improved food security and income for the poor and disadvantaged households in remote areas of Nepal . VSP-III will have two major focuses: 1) farm families from poor and DAGs produce and sell quality seeds; and 2) National Seed Board, Nepal Agriculture Research Council and Department of Agriculture enforce decentralised seed production and quality control through public and private institutions. VSP has proven synergies with other SDC supported agricultural projects, such as the Hill Maize Research Project in promoting seed related market and policy issues and the Home garden project in promoting diversification of vegetable production.

shortdescription: ASSISTANCE MATRIELLE ET SERVICES D URGENCE
projecttitle: Assistance matrielle et services d urgence
longdescription: The Safer Migration (SaMi) project will contribute to decreasing the socio-economic and psychosocial costs by building the migrants  knowledge about the migration process and their rights and by providing legal and psychosocial support to those who were victimized in the migration process. SaMi aims at increasing the benefits of migration by providing skills trainings for potential migrants especially to people from poor and socially discriminated groups (DAG) of Khotang district. The Government of Nepal together with civil society partners will be supported to identify a strategy to better implement the Foreign Employment Act (FEA).

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: Outcomes (objectives) of the phase: Through the strengthened BOGs Secretariat, the donors will analyse and address operational space issues in view of the following outcomes:  1) Operational space as well as security and safety of development workers in Nepal are ensured. 2) Issues on BOGs violations are identified within the BOGs group and taken up at policy level.

The Department of Local Infrastructure Development and Agricultural Roads of the Ministry of Local Development (DoLIDAR/MoLD) is responsible for construction and maintenance of motorable bridges in addition to local roads but it has limited capacity to shoulder this responsibility. DoLIDAR is desirous of a) developing norms and standards appropriate to local roads and b) strengthening its capacities as well as that of the private sector so that these pilots can be replicated. In this regard, GoN has requested SDC to support them with technical assistance. Switzerland has gained significant recognition and visibility in Nepal over the last 4 decades through its engagement in the transport sector, particularly in the trail-bridge and local road sectors.

shortdescription: STATE BUILDING AT LOCAL LEVEL PROJECT
projecttitle: State Building at Local Level Project
purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: The ten-year long conflict (1996-2006) not only had a negative impact on the countries  socio-economic development, but also destroyed and weakened many of its institutions including those at the local level: the village development committees (VDCs) and the district development committees (DDCs). The absence of elected VDC and DDC representatives since 2002 and a weak state have allowed political parties, private sector entrepreneurs and sometimes the administration itself to influence decisions and appropriate resources. SDC proposes to provide a modest budget support to the DDCs in two of its three focus districts: Khotang and Okhaldunga. Coupled with the current SDC presence and positioning in these districts, the budget support should allow SDC to increase its leverage and delivery of development outcomes. The project is also expected to foster a culture of dialogue (and control) among all stakeholders. This should build up experiences and skills that can be used by both the existing local administrations (and the political parties) to prepare for the upcoming transition towards a new federal state, and the new federal unit to possibly build upon. In this sense, the project is also expected to contribute to a smoother transition and prevent conflict.

The Programme s goal is to contribute to reduced emission of GHG and pollution in the construction sector to mitigate global warming, environmental and health degradation. To achieve this the Programme will be playing a stronger role in policy dialogue, advocacy and awareness creation. The context is favourable for a total elimination of the most polluting brick production factories in Kathmandu Valley. The outcomes are as follows: - Building materials and construction entrepreneurs adopt environmental friendly technologies and demonstrate a socially responsible behaviour; - Real estate developers and individuals construct their own houses in urban and semi-urban areas using energy efficient building materials and technologies (ownership and marking); and - Government of Nepal (GoN) have a favourable policy environment promoting clean production technologies in the brick sector (i.e. incentives for cleaner production). To ensure sustainability of the programme the required support services will be institutionalized and privatised. In addition alliances with main donors and international as well as local partners will be established.

shortdescription: RIVER PROTECTION WORKS IN EAST CHITWAN
projecttitle: River Protection Works in East Chitwan
longdescription: The main goal of the project is to safeguard the people and assets of eastern Chitwan from flood related disaster and improve their livelihoods and food security. Expected outputs (1): Local communities along Rapti River and in the project VDCs build and rehabilitate river protection works. (2): Local communities rehabilitate the irrigation canals originating from Rapti river. (3): User s committee and its sub committees formed to implement the works. (4): Communities, VDCs and the DDC strengthen their capacity to engage in dialogues with the central Government on the need to undertake larger integrated watershed management initiatives.

shortdescription: NEPAL RESIDENT COORDINATOR OFFICE SUPPORT IN TRANSITION
projecttitle: Nepal Resident Coordinator Office Support in Transition
channelname: UNITED NATIONS AGENCIES, FUNDS AND COMMISSIONS
longdescription: This initiative is in line with SDC s priorities both at a global level, regarding the UN coherence and improved response in post-conflict transition, and at Nepal level as the country is still in a critical phase of the peace process. The Transition support strategy (TSS) supports the strengthening of relevant actors in the peace process and the stronger coordination and harmonisation of development partners.

The Goal is to contribute for  improved livelihoods and resilience of poor men, women and children in Nepal . The Purpose is  maximise the contribution of Nepal s forestry sector to inclusive economic growth, poverty reduction and tackling climate change . Coverage will increase from 4 districts (current Swiss coverage) to 61 districts (out of 75 nationally) with full-fledged focused activities in 35 over the next 10 years. Focus is to expand poverty reduction and environmental outcomes of community forestry nationally through wider reach and deeper engagement at different levels.

The Employment Fund s mandate to fund mobile, short-term skills training linked to employment opportunities in the domestic and international labour markets is a relevant strategy. The intervention is targeted at Nepali youth from DAGs below 10th. grade of education. It is contributing towards a long-expected peace dividend for the people. Overall goal: To improve the living conditions of economically and socially disadvantaged youth (16-35 years) in Nepal. Outcomes of the phase: (1) Young women and men, especially those belonging to DAGs are gainfully employed. (2): The Employment Fund Secretariat and its Training & Employment (T&E) service providers are successful institutions in the technical education and vocational training (TEVT) Sector. Coordination and synergies with other projects and actors: This proposed phase will be a harmonized phase with DFID (joint logframe and project document, tripartite agreement with the GoN). The EF has been procuring services from 22 private service providers including the SDC-funded F-Skill project.

channelname: International Committee of the Red Cross
longdescription: Switzerland s objectives to provide financial support to the ICRC are the following: (1) To protect the lives and dignity of all persons affected by armed conflict and other situations of armed violence; (2) To respond to emergencies in a timely and effective manner; (3) To support an internationally recognized humanitarian organization which mandate as well as guiding principles have proven to be essential to preserve humanitarian space in situations of armed conflict; (4) To promote the compliance with the Geneva Conventions, the Additional Protocols and the International Humanitarian Law (IHL); (5) To support the operational division of labour established by  the Sevilla Agreement , whereby the ICRC has the lead in coordinating operations in situations of conflict and of internal disturbances; (6) To encourage complimentary interventions together with SDC programmes, whenever relevant.

shortdescription: TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SKILL FOR EMPLOYMENT PROJECT
projecttitle: Technical Assistance to Skill for Employment Project

purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management

longdescription: SDC has been supporting the small irrigation sector since August 2006 with Local Infrastructure for Livelihood Improvement (LILI) Phase I, which has also been co-funded by Helvetas under its strategic partnership with DFID and executed by Helvetas. The target groups for LILI include marginalized and small farmers having farming-land below 0.25 hectare. The achievements of LILI Phase I are encouraging. A total of 64 small irrigation schemes, 3 vegetable collection centres and 29 public-buildings are expected to be completed by end of the Phase I, July 2009. The irrigation has been the main component. LILI monitoring report (March 2009) shows that about 88% LILI-supported farmers have diversified/ intensified cropping practices, and thus increased annual agriculture production by 50%. LILI Phase I has also improved knowledge and capacity of DDCs and local institutions/organizations to build and manage farmers-managed small irrigations. As suggested by the Internal Project Review and a Special Study carried out by SDC Coof, the support to public-buildings will discontinue in Phase II in order to be more focused to the small irrigation systems. Based on good experience made during Phase I, a second phase of four years is proposed. The Goal of LILI phase II is to contribute to  Improved food security of small farmers in the rural areas of eight districts .

purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: LGCDP's over-arching goal is to contribute towards poverty reduction through inclusive responsive and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development that will ensure increased involvement of women, Dalits, Adibasi Janajatis, Muslims, Madhesis, disadvantaged groups in the local governance process. The programme will contribute towards attaining the goal through achieving its three major Programme Outcomes: (1) Citizens and communities empowered to exercise their voice and to engage actively with local governments on resource allocation and decision making; (2) Increased capacity of local governments to manage resources and deliver basic services in an inclusive and equitable manner; and (3) Strengthened policy and national institutional framework for decentralization, devolution and community development.

shortdescription: REDUCING DISABILITIES THROUGH A SUPPORT TO THE HOSPITAL AND REHABILITATION CENTRE FOR DISABLED CHILDREN (HRDC)
projecttitle: Reducing disabilities through a support to the Hospital and Rehabilitation centre for Disabled Children (HRDC)
longdescription: An estimate 5% of the population of Nepal is affected with physical disabilities and their livelihood is affected far beyond the physical handicap itself. They suffer from exclusion and social stigma, which in turn reduces their ability to be socially and economically integrated. The HRDC is since over 25 years the leading institution providing services to disabled children and will be able to treat some 15 000 children per year with the equipment and mobile teams facilities made available through this programme.

shortdescription: REHABILITATION OF CRITICAL TRAIL BRIDGES   SINGLE PHASE
projecttitle: Rehabilitation of Critical Trail Bridges   Single Phase
longdescription: The lack of physical access to economic opportunities, natural resources and social services is highly correlated with incidence of poverty in Nepal. Social and economic vulnerability of disadvantaged groups is often exacerbated by reduced access to road network. One of the major reasons for constraints in rural Nepal is in-adequate or  unsafe  river crossings and lack of its maintenance. The proposed intervention will improve  safe  river crossings by rehabilitating the 137  critical  trail bridges.

shortdescription: LEGAL AID TO IMPROVE PEOPLE'S ACCESS TO CRIMINAL DEFENCE SERVICES
projecttitle: Legal Aid to Improve People's Access to Criminal Defence Services
longdescription: Contribute to the development of an effective criminal legal aid system in Nepal that ensures access to justice for all women and men.

Past SDC interventions have focussed on making rural road construction work for the poor and disadvantaged through labour-intensive construction methods. This project now takes proven approaches further by ensuring even more all-weather accessibility to markets and services by emphasising the importance of maintenance and preservation of built roads through promotion of labour-based roads maintenance methods and by fostering an institutional process in the districts, which should pave the way for the highly successful concepts of road construction and maintenance to be adopted as national standards.

purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: The project empowers communities to claim their developmental rights by capacitating local civil society organisations (CSOs) to hold their local governments accountable. This is achieved by applying various social accountability (SA) tools. A protracted phase of political transition, a lack of structural accountability and transparency, rising corruption at all levels of government, and an absence of elected representatives makes the intervention highly relevant for target communities in SDC project areas.

purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: The project empowers communities to claim their developmental rights by capacitating local civil society organisations (CSOs) to hold their local governments accountable. This is achieved by applying various social accountability (SA) tools. A protracted phase of political transition, a lack of structural accountability and transparency, rising corruption at all levels of government, and an absence of elected representatives makes the intervention highly relevant for target communities in SDC project areas.

SDC has been supporting HMRP since 1999. HMRP had very encouraging achievements in the first three phases, such as: i) setting of the maize research priorities, establishing participatory variety selection, validation and certification methodologies, linking research with extension for wider dissemination, ii) certification of nine improved varieties and production of 4,416 MT of improved maize seeds, and iii) linking farmer s feedback to policy decisions through farmer s assessment tests over released varieties. HMRP has contributed to establishing a national research system, linking research with extension and strengthening farmers  groups to produce maize seeds and deal with markets for better and assured prices. This fourth phase will focus on strengthening seeds dissemination channels, developing market links, ensuring the decentralized seed quality assurance system and developing more new maize varieties as the demand remains high.

Through its project planning and implementation approach RHDP has empowered community groups, especially women, and also influenced the village development committees (VDCs) to integrate community health demands in VDC planning, and thus contributed to local state building and better service delivery. After 17 years of cooperation, this will be the last phase of RHDP that will focus on consolidation and sustainability. As in the past, the project will aim at improving overall health status of people, especially of women, poor and disadvantaged groups in remote areas of Dolakha, Ramechhap and Okhaldhunga districts. Primary beneficiaries will be women, children, adolescents, and men, with special attention to Dalits and Janajatis.

Through its project planning and implementation approach RHDP has empowered community groups, especially women, and also influenced the village development committees (VDCs) to integrate community health demands in VDC planning, and thus contributed to local state building and better service delivery. After 17 years of cooperation, this will be the last phase of RHDP that will focus on consolidation and sustainability. As in the past, the project will aim at improving overall health status of people, especially of women, poor and disadvantaged groups in remote areas of Dolakha, Ramechhap and Okhaldhunga districts. Primary beneficiaries will be women, children, adolescents, and men, with special attention to Dalits and Janajatis.

The Project Support Unit (PSU) supports the capacity building in the districts, for implementation of rural infrastructure and community development activities. The District Development Committees (DDC) and local groups implement the works, with support from the PSU. DoLIDAR is responsible for the Planning, Coordination, Fund flow and Monitoring of the Programme. SDC has inducted many good practices across the rural road projects in Nepal. The green roads concept has been adopted nationally. Until recently unheard issues of workers  welfare are now being translated into policy, that include insurance, work safety, equal wage for equal work and facilities that help women to participate.

The Programme s goal is to contribute to reduced emission of GHG and pollution in the construction sector to mitigate global warming, environmental and health degradation. To achieve this the Programme will be playing a stronger role in policy dialogue, advocacy and awareness creation. The context is favourable for a total elimination of the most polluting brick production factories in Kathmandu Valley. The outcomes are as follows: - Building materials and construction entrepreneurs adopt environmental friendly technologies and demonstrate a socially responsible behaviour; - Real estate developers and individuals construct their own houses in urban and semi-urban areas using energy efficient building materials and technologies (ownership and marking); and - Government of Nepal (GoN) have a favourable policy environment promoting clean production technologies in the brick sector (i.e. incentives for cleaner production). To ensure sustainability of the programme the required support services will be institutionalized and privatised. In addition alliances with main donors and international as well as local partners will be established.

purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management

longdescription: The Programme will bring economic benefits among poor communities, by improving access to markets and services. It also addresses poverty by generating off-farm employment of 2600 person days per bridge directly. It will ensure increased participation of disadvantaged groups and women in bridge building initiatives and empower them for better governance. As a result of these Swiss supports, a Sector Wide Approach is conceived by GoN with WB, ADB, DFID and SDC.

shortdescription: POWER PLANT EXTENSION SCECO (PPE SCECO), NEPAL
projecttitle: Power Plant Extension SCECO (PPE SCECO), Nepal   Single Phase
longdescription: The Power Plant Extension of SCECO will improve daily living condition and enhance economic opportunities by providing uninterrupted hydro-power supply to 1 400 customers, and get up to 500 new connections to the local power grid, in the area of Salleri/Garma/Phalpu (HDI 0.45-0.50). Additionally, it will mitigate uncontrolled deforestation by reducing the use of firewood for cooking, heating and lighting purposes, in an area (lying between 2400   3000m alt.) where forest regeneration is slow. The project will thus enhance the sustainable use of local water resources while contributing to the maintenance of resilience to climate change at the local level.

shortdescription: TERAI HUMAN RIGHTS DEFENDERS ALLIANCE: PROMOTING HUMAN RIGHTS, EQUITY AND JUSTICE IN TERAI
projecttitle: Terai Human Rights Defenders Alliance: Promoting Human Rights, Equity and Justice in Terai
longdescription: The Terai Human Rights Defenders Alliance (THRDA) is strengthening equity and justice in Nepal. With activities in three fields (research and publication, dialogue and advocacy) THRDA encourages minorities and disadvantaged people from the Terai region to engage in the political processes. A more inclusive political process helps to reduce frustration and violence among the people.

shortdescription: NEPAL LAW SOCIETY: CONSTITUTION INFORMATION SHARING THROUGH CONSTITUTION INFORMATION CENTERS
projecttitle: Nepal Law Society: Constitution Information Sharing through Constitution Information Centers
longdescription: The Constitution Information Centers (CIC) were established by the Nepal Law Society to help the Constituent Assembly (CA) disseminate its updated and authentic information to the public and, thereby, help dissipate the increasing anxiety among the public regarding the apparent delay in the writing of a new constitution. The CIC will hold sharing and interaction programs on key constitutional and political issues and be in charge of the already established libraries. By supporting CIC the Swiss Human Security Division can contribute to the constitution process and help finding a way out of the political deadlock in Nepal.

shortdescription: OPERATIONAL BUDGET 2012/2013 HUMAN SECURITY ADVISER IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Operational Budget 2012/2013 Human Security Adviser in Nepal
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: In November 2006 a Comprehensive Peace Accord was signed by the CPN (Maoist) and the Government of Nepal that ended 10 years of armed conflict. Key provisions of the agreement have yet to be implemented. Switzerland contributes in various ways to the peace process, in particular through its Senior Human Security Adviser in Nepal. He provides support for the implementation of the provisions of the Comprehensive Peace Accord, inter alia through small projects like workshops, seminars and capacity building. These activities are financed with a larger framework credit to keep the administrative input low.

purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: As the constitution-making process is part of the peace process in Nepal, Switzerland has been supporting the constitution-making process by sending a constitutional expert. This expert has been working jointly with the Swiss Peacebuilding Advisor for the last two years. It was decided to prolong the engagement of the constitutional expert for another 6 months as the Constitution-making, which was supposed to be concluded by May 2010, had to be prolonged by twelve months for different reasons. In order to guarantee a smooth realization of her engagement, her running budget has to be prolonged, too.

shortdescription: TRIAL: VICTIMS OF INTERNATIONAL CRIMES NEPAL
projecttitle: TRIAL: Victims of international crimes Nepal
longdescription: The overall aim of the project is to help victims of international crimes in Nepal obtain justice by offering free legal support to victims, by submitting cases to the UN Human Rights Committee and by training local lawyers and NGO representatives the necessary tools for independently submitting cases to international human rights bodies in the future.

shortdescription: SOCIAL SCIENCE BAHA/CONFERENCE AUG. 2011, LAST PAYMENT
projecttitle: Social Science Baha/Conference Aug. 2011, last payment
purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
longdescription: The conference aims on one side to draw big lines of action for the coming years and on the other hand to demonstrate the enormous political changes, which took place the last 20 years in Nepal, as too many people in the country can t see any movement in politics and society. The contributions of the participants illustrating these lines on one side and the positive changes on the other should then be used by the politicians as lessons learnt for their work.

shortdescription: DEMOCRATIC FREEDOM AND HUMAN RIGHTS INSTITUTE PROMOTING HUMAN SECURITY IN TARAI
projecttitle: Democratic Freedom and Human Rights Institute Promoting Human Security in Tarai
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: The project has four components; first, it intends to gather information on major issues that are contributing to human security challenges in Tarai. The research findings will be published and made public and also used for policy advocacy. Second, top political leaders from Tarai will be consulted to talk on reports for policy change. Third, four episodes of television program will be produced and aired through television based on the research findings. Fourth, two trainings on human security issues will be organized for Tarai-based human rights defenders.

shortdescription: PROMOTING DIALOGUE THROUGHTHE  NEPAL TRANSITION TO PEACE FORUM
projecttitle: Promoting dialogue throughthe  Nepal Transition to Peace Forum
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: This project aims to further support the Nepal Transition to Peace Forum in its function as an accepted and trusted dialogue space for political parties. The support is channeled through The Asia Foundation, which manages the work of the Nepal Transition to Peace Forum. The forum is facilitated by two well-respected national facilitators and it includes the participation of second-tier politicians from major political parties. The work of the forum will be crucial for the final stages of the constitution drafting as well as for the following consultation and implementation processes. Switzerland is participating in the process through the Swiss Senior Advisor for Peacebuilding who assists the NTTP facilitators.

shortdescription: NATIONAL ELECTION OBSERVATION COMMITTEE/MONITORING VOTERS REGISTRATION NEPA
projecttitle: National Election Observation Committee/Monitoring Voters Registration Nepa
longdescription: The project aims to monitor the voter s registration program, which is carried out by the Election Commission of Nepal. It will measure its effectiveness and examines the lapses, weaknesses of the past voters registration system in light of current method to advance fair, inclusive and appropriate registration.

shortdescription: DEALING WITH THE PAST ACTIVITIES IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Dealing with the Past Activities in Nepal
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: Dealing with the Past (DwP) is a priority for the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs and the Human Security Division (HSD). The current project seeks to provide insights into opportunities and limits of specific HSD activities in the area of DwP. In particular it is planned to provide insights into the process of DwP through a newspaper report as well as to build on lessons learnt from Sri Lanka regarding the development of a data base that contains human rights violations.

channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
longdescription: The integration of the Maoist People s Liberation Army into the regular Nepal Army and the signing of the seven point agreement in November 2011 provide a favourable momentum to achieve further goals in Nepal s peace process. The reorganization of the security sector is of utmost importance and is also closely connected to the constitution process. By involving local players from the onset and Berghof s network of international experts, this project aims to kick-start the discussions on a national security strategy for Nepal. It is planned to trigger and enrich a substantial and inclusive debate on the main frameworks, elements and principles of a national security policy.

shortdescription: TWO WORKSHOPS ON STATE RESTRUCTURING, TRANSITION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NEW CONSTITUTION IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Two Workshops on state restructuring, transition and implementation of the new constitution in Nepal
purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: A successful transformation of Nepal into a functioning federal system crucially depends on the smooth and swift transition from the current model of governance to the one that will be prescribed in the new Constitution. There is ample experience and precedent for transitional arrangements relating to the continued applicability of laws, and the exercise of executive, legislative and judicial powers in the Interim period, around the world as well as in Nepal itself. Two Workshops that deal with transitional provisions regarding Restructuring of the State and Timelines should prepare key members of the Constituent Assembly for the transition period.

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: In November 2006 a Comprehensive Peace Accord was signed by the Maoist Party and the Government of Nepal that ended 10 years of armed conflict. The armed conflict has claimed more than 15,000 lives and many people suffered from human rights violations from all sides. Switzerland contributed in various ways to the peace process by being actively engaged in the informal facilitation of the peace talks. The Senior Adviser for Peacebuilding in Nepal provides support for the implementation of the provisions of the Comprehensive Peace Accord, including democratic state-building and the promotion of human security. Small projects like workshops, seminars and capacity building in the area of state restructuring, constitutional affairs, federalism and Security Sector Reform SSR have been a useful instrument. These activities are financed with a larger framework credit to keep the administrative input.

The project seeks to overcome imbalance and inequalities being faced by minority groups, especially women, Madheshi, Dalits\ religious and linguistic groups by strengthening capacity of minority civil society to engage in targeted advocacy to demand for the incorporation and implementation of the minority rights provisions in the Constitution. It will also focus on sensitizing a wide range of stakeholders (from minority activists to representatives of government) on the importance of the human rights of minority and indigenous communities, the national and international instruments existing to protect those and how to ensure that appropriate mechanisms are adopted and implemented to guarantee the respect of these nghts.

shortdescription: LAW AND POLICY FORUM FOR SOCIALJUSTICE: TV DEBATE CONSTITUTION DRAFTING
projecttitle: Law and Policy Forum for SocialJustice: TV Debate Constitution Drafting
longdescription: Drafting a new constitution that reflects the aspirations of the Nepali people arid guarantees fundamental rights, rule of law and democratic values is one of the main tasks of the Constituent Assembly (CA). In order to make this process more comprehensive and inclusive, the Law and Policy Forum for Social Justice (LAPSOJ) devised a TV program on the content and process of constitution making. This serial TV debate provides a platform for experts of constitutional law to contribute to the constitution making process. Another aim of the program is to provide proper information to CA members and political party leaders. At the same time it informs the audience on the progress of the new constitution, raises awareness and eventually provides the people with a sense of ownership about the new constitution.

shortdescription: CONTRIBUTION TO PEACE BRIGADES INTERNATIONAL IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Contribution to Peace Brigades International in Nepal
purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: The main focus of Peace Brigades Internation in Nepal is the provision of protective accompaniment to human rights defenders and organisations facing difficulties in carrying out their work. As such, team members physically accompany local civil society activists at risk, deterring potential threats and encouraging increased efforts for the promotion of peaceful solutions to armed conflict and for the respect of human rights. Accompaniment is only provided after an assessment of the request and of the current situation. Furthermore, it is contingent upon networking with local authorities.

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: As the constitution-making process is part of the peace process in Nepal, Switzerland has been supporting the constitution-making process by sending a constitutional expert. This expert has been working jointly with the Swiss Peacebuilding Advisor for the last two years. It was decided to prolong the engagement of the constitutional expert for another 6 months as the Constitution-making, which was supposed to be concluded by May 2010, had to be prolonged by twelve months for different reasons.

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: The four main political parties, meeting under the auspices of the Nepal Transition to Peace Initiative, have asked Switzerland to organize a second. round of negotiations in Switzerland, based on their positive experience from a similar retreat in 2011. The aim is to tackle the last remaining stumbling blocks in the constitution drafting process, i.e. form of government and federal system. Switzerland will provide logistical support, facilitation and expertise.

purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: In November 2006 a Comprehensive Peace Accord signed by the CPN (Maoist) and the Government of Nepal ended 10 years of armed conflict, but key provisions of the agreement have yet to be implemented. Switzerland contributes in various ways to the peace process, in particular by providing support to political parties and civil society organizations through an expert on issues related to federalism and other constitutional issues. Due to the extension of Constituent Assembly's mandate, the mandate of the expert was extended as well until the end of 2012. The present proposal provides for a new operational budget for the expert.

shortdescription: FORUM OF FEDERATIONS: SYSTEM OF FISCAL TRANSFERS NEPAL
projecttitle: Forum of Federations: System of fiscal transfers Nepal
purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: Nepal is undergoing a major transition to introduce a system of democratic federal governance. One of the immediate challenges after Nepal adopts a federal constitution is to design and implement a suitable system of fiscal transfers to provide the new decentralized units with suitable financial means. This project aims to increase knowledge in, and acceptance for, designing the system of fiscal transfers with representatives of relevant Nepali institutions and political leaders. The Forum of Federation will carry out a consultation process on fiscal transfers leading to the publication of conclusions on a  Design and Implementation Plan .

purposename: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution
longdescription: In November 2006 a Comprehensive Peace Accord was signed by the CPN (Maoist) and the Government of Nepal that ended 10 years of armed conflict. Key provisions of the agreement have yet to be implemented. Switzerland contributes in various ways to the peace process, in particular through its Senior Peacebuilding Advisor in Nepal. He provides support for the implementation of the provisions of the Comprehensive Peace Accord, inter alia through small projects like workshops, seminars and capacity building. These activities are financed with a larger framework credit to keep the administrative input low.

purposename: Decentralisation and support to subnational govt.
longdescription: The constitution-making process, as integral part of the peace process in Nepal has been supported by the Swiss constitutional expert since 2009. Due to the political stalemate on contentious issues the constitution-making process was delayed. The constituent assembly s mandate was renewed three times in 2011 and a draft constitution is now due by 27 May 2012. Until a draft of the constitution is presented the expert will continue to support the drafting process. Once a draft is presented the Swiss expert will support the deliberations in the assembly, drafting of amendments as well as the public consultation process and the preparations for the implementation of the constitution. After the promulgation of the constitution the Swiss expert will support the implementation of the constitution.

shortdescription: TRIAL: HELPING VICTIMS OF INTERNATIONAL CRIMES IN NEPAL OBTAINING JUSTICE
projecttitle: TRIAL: Helping victims of international crimes in Nepal obtaining Justice
longdescription: Given the complete failure of the domestic legal system in Nepal to provide redress for victims of serious conflict-related and post-conflict human rights violations, resorting to international organs is often the only avenue available for victims to obtain some form of justice. However, these mechanisms are still considerably underused in Nepal. Through this project, the Geneva based organization TRIAL seeks to help victims prepare their cases for submission before the United Nations Human Rights Committee and thus obtain justice.

shortdescription: UNWOMEN SUPPORT FOR WOMEN IN SUFFERED IN CONFLICT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: UNWomen support for women in suffered in conflict in Nepal
channelname: United Nations Entity for Gender Equality and the Empowerment of Women
longdescription: UN Women will support coherence and coordination across the UN system in advancing women's participation in conflict resolution. UN Women will support existing and new efforts to improve the protection environment for women during and after conflict, to engage women in conflict prevention, and to ensure peacebuilding processes are guided by womens perspectives and address their needs. Promotion of equality, including gender equality, and womens and girls rights are explicitly mentioned in the Finnish Development Policy.
The project's aim is to develop the Nepalese trade unions in the financing sector by training and cooperation.

Empowering Partners for Social Responsibility. The project aims to increase the capacity of a local partner to do holistic development work in local communities. Nepal is one of the poorest countries in the world, where majority of the people live in rural areas. Fida s partner in Nepal is the Assemblies of God church (AOG). The project provides training and awareness-raising for the partner on a great variety of issues related to development work. Fida and AOG work together in the local communities and through this hands-on development work the partner acquires practical skills. The project focuses on three major components: Literacy, Community Health Education (CHE) and HIV/AIDS. As AOG s skills and knowledge grow, the partner will become increasingly capable of doing effective community development work of its own. This will contribute to the increasing impact of the partner s work at community level.

Maithili Empowerment Programme. The programme seeks to increase a local partner s capacity to respond to the needs of the Maithili minority in Southern Nepal. The 2.5 million Maithili of Southern Nepal make up the country s largest ethnic minority. Formerly known for their rich culture and traditions, the Maithili now live in poverty and have almost lost their unique identity. To address the needs of the Maithili, Fida partners with a local NGO called Relative Nepal, which belongs to the Assemblies of God Nepal (AGN) church. The programme offers the partner hands-on training in community development work. The main approach used is that of Community Health Education. The work carried out among the Maithili communities includes e.g. literacy training, basic education and cultural revitalization activities. Through the trainings and practical development work conducted during the programme, the partner s capacities build up and, at the same time, the needs of the Maithili communities are addressed. Already one school has been established and children s literacy classes started. These together will contribute towards the improvement of the quality of life in the Maithili communities.

purposename: Basic life skills for youth & adults
longdescription: Youth Centre in Kathmandu. The project seeks to empower a local partner for youth work of its own. Now, after the civil war, the capital of Kathmandu is facing a huge wave of immigration from the rural areas to the city. The young generation in particular is moving into the city in search for work, but lacks sufficient skills and training. Fida partners with the Assemblies of God church (AOG) to address the needs of the youth. Fida and its partner will establish a youth centre in the capital that provides vocational training and counselling to the youth, and facilities for leisure time activities. The AOG church youth will act as volunteers at the centre. Through the youth centre the partner will learn to work with the youth in practice. The youth, in turn, will have their educational and other needs addressed. All in all, the project will improve the life skills of the youth.

The project will form Health and Sanitation groups (called WASH groups) in each VDC to address the root causes (contaminated water, poor sanitation and personal hygiene practices) of the main problem, high incidence of the intestinal diseases.

The overall objective of the project is to increase biodiesel feedstock and promote clean energy and rural income generation through management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas.Specific objectives are 1)to analyze the land use patterns and suitability for Jatropha curcas cultivation, 2)to increase awareness on collection, management and cultivation of Jatropha curcas, 3)to produce Jatropha seedlings for commercial plantation,  4)to improve local economy through Jatropha seed production, 5)to establish marketing linkage between Jatropha producers and biodiesel company, 6)to conduct trial experiment for optimization of Jatropha genotype and place, 7)to conduct a pilot scale biodiesel testing program.

shortdescription: IMPROVING REHABILITATION SERVICES FOR PEOPLE WITH SPINAL CORD INJURY IN WESTERN NEPAL
projecttitle: Improving rehabilitation services for people with spinal cord injury in Western Nepal
longdescription: Spinal cord injury rehabilitation is a major unmet need in Nepal. In Nepal most cases are caused by falls from heights chiefly from trees (from which poor farmers cut fodder for their stock) and building sites. Road traffic accidents are an increasing cause of SCI. There are currently only three centres in the whole country offering rehabilitation services to people with spinal cord injuries ? two of the three are in Kathmandu. GPHRC provides services to the Western Development Region and through four INF clinics to the Mid-Western Development Region - a total population of around 8.5 million people. At present large proportion of SCI patients present for rehabilitation with pressure sores. These patients require admissions up to 6 months as the pressure sore needs to heal before rehabilitation can commence. Patients admitted without pressure sores can complete the rehabilitation within 6-8 weeks. The project ?Improving rehabilitation services for people with spinal cord injury in western Nepal? will be implemented by International Nepal Fellowship Nepal?s (INF/Nepal) Green Pastures Hospital and Rehabilitation Centre (GPHRC) in collaboration with government and private hospitals in Pokhara Nepal and INF?s Partnership for Rehabilitation (PFR) which supports community-based rehabilitation services in the Western Region of Nepal. This project has three major objectives:1. To reduce the incidence of secondary complications in new cases of spinal cord injury (SCI) by providing health education and essential equipment to patients in primary (trauma) care 2. To provide better quality rehabilitation services to SCI clients through building a appropriately designed 12 bed SCI ward block at GPHRC 3. To reduce the incidence of infections and pressure sores in SCI patients after their return home and thereby reduce the rate of re-admission and improve their quality of life

shortdescription: PHYSICAL EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT PROJECT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Physical Education Development Project in Nepal
channelreportedname: HealthPhysical and Population Education Department (Faculty of Education);Tribhuvan University (TU)
longdescription: The Physical Education Development Pilot Project 2013-2014 is LiiKe's first project in Nepal. It is planned in close cooperation with the Tribhuvan University's (TU) Department of Health Physical and Population Education which is the local partner in the project. The pilot project is the first step to aiming at: - increasing the equal access to Physical Education for boys and girls - increasing the gender balance within the teachers who are teaching Physical Education- improving the quality of the PE education- getting the Physical Education into practice and outside the classroom when possible- raising awareness of the importance of Physical Education in the sense of physical health and fitness on the one hand and mental and social health of the students on the other hand- raising awareness of the positive impact that physical activity has on learning- raising awareness that through sports and games all the students can learn skills for life and sometimes find a career or become an athlete- improving the Physical Education curriculum and- improving and formalizing the status of Physical Education as a school subject.In the project ten districts and twenty higher secondary schools (grades 11-12) are chosen from all of the five development regions of Nepal. Districts will be selected considering the Hill and Terai settings. Twenty teachers (female and male) get an intensive training for conducting games and sports for the students. Back in the schools and districts presentation will be given about the key findings to community and the school presonnel. In the schools teachers start programme that includes different sports and games as regular activity and in the form of tournaments. The project schools are provided with necessary games and sports equipment. The students from grades 11 to 12 are the future primary school (grades 1-8) teachers which adds the value of the programme.The field supervisors are nominated to monitor and support the implementation of the programme in the schools. The experiences from the students and teachers will be collected before and after the school year in which the project is implemented and best practices manual 'How to make Physical Education accessible for boys and girls' will be made based on that. In the beginning of the project and after the implementation seminar will be held for all the stakeholders including the Ministry of Education in order to reach the decision-makers.

shortdescription: OUR SCHOOL IS A GOOD SCHOOL PRIMARY EDUCATION DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
projecttitle: Our school is a good school primary education development project
longdescription: Nepal s education system can t offer child friendly school environment to all. Project s development problem is that public schools and teachers lack adequate teaching learning methods and infrastructure resulting children dropping out of schools. This project aims to strengthen teacher s role in their community and inside the education system, form learning network among teachers, promote child s rights and participation in schools and sensitize stakeholders to take responsible role for implementation. Through these activities the objective of this project: Child Friendly School concept is widely accepted and practiced in public schools in the project area. Motivated and skilful teachers and inspiring and safe school environment are available to all the children at the 14 schools in 5 VDCs will be reached.

shortdescription: ENHANCING CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Enhancing Child Protection System in Nepal
longdescription: In spite of commitment, government of Nepal has been inefficient to meet the requirements for protecting children from different forms of abuse, violence and exploitation. NGOs have become crucial actors, though the actions of NGOs are also questioned and sometimes their capacities and skills are also questioned. The government child protection policies are still waiting for formal adaptation. The project aims at establishing child protection system and mechanism at local level with appropriate policy guidance. Specific objectives are: promotion of national child protection network, application of child protection policies, and strengthening of local child protection committees. The project has component of advocacy, network building, capacity building, and production and sharing of resource materials.

shortdescription: RURAL WATER SUPPLY AND SANITATION PROJECT-WESTERN NEPAL COMPLETION PHASE
projecttitle: Rural Water Supply and Sanitation Project-Western Nepal Completion Phase
longdescription: RWSSP Completion Phase will continue support to advance rural water supply and sanitation in western Nepal. Nepal's national goal is to reach total clean water and sanitation coverage by 2017. Access to clean water and sanitation is one of the basic human rights. In this respect awareness of rural population on these rights will be increased and the capacity of the 'duty bearers' i.e. national institutions to respond with sufficient service provision will be strengthened. A phasing-out strategy will be prepared to ensure transfer of responsibilities and sustainability of results after the end of the project. Expansion of the project's scope to rural livelihoods will be explored during the planning phase. Arsenic mitigation will be taken into account in the Terai-region.

shortdescription: NP/PYM SARVODAYA NEPAL TEACH FOR NEPAL
projecttitle: NP/PYM Sarvodaya Nepal Teach for Nepal
longdescription: The overall objective of the project is to  create national movement Teach for Nepal of young people to enhance quality of education in public schools in Nepal.  The project aims to attract outstanding university graduates and young professionals to teach in public and community schools for two years as Fellows primarily in maths science and English to decrease achievement gaps that exists between private and public schools students. The project will be co-funded with Nepalese private sector companies. Private sector will also offer working placements for the Fellows after their two years engagement is public schools.

Overall objective: To raise the voice of Dalit from local level by improving the quality and quantity of media coverage on issues of Dalit, its rights, diversity and social inclusion. Increase Dalit journalists within and outside the Dalit organizations, Sensitize the non-dalit journalists and media houses on dalit issues to develop and mainstream dalit issues into their regular programme, Institutionalization of Radio Jagaran through internal system development and connecting with people and institutions under cooperative model.

shortdescription: TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR LEASEHOLD FOREST AND LIVESTOCK DEVELOPMENT
projecttitle: Technical Assistance for Leasehold Forest and Livestock Development
longdescription: Technical Assistance programme to be implemented through a partnership between IFAD and FAO, is proposed. The main objective is to improve the effectiveness of LFLP and support the implementation, institutionalization and scaling up of the poverty reducing leasehold forestry programme in the country. The key activities include: integration of leasehold forestry and livestock development for poverty alleviation; consolidation and improvement of the extension strategies; follow-up the findings of the studies carried out by the ongoing IFAD supported LFLP and FAO supported TCP Project: institutional framework for a greater contribution of forests and trees to poverty reduction; institutionalization of the and livestock development for poverty alleviation and environmental conservation; establishment and promotion of a goat breeding centre.

There is a need for strengthening of the forestry sector information systems, to enable the realistic preparation of new Master plan and to monitor effectively the impact of recent forest activities after conflict period. The use of TA aim to strengthen the procedures needed for the capture and processing of the National level statistics and support district level forest decision making as well dissemination of information. The overall objective is to strengthen national forest policy level decisions.

geography: Baitadi, Darchula, Doti, Kailali, Dadeldhura, Myagdi, Nawalparasi, Arghakhanchi, Panchthar, Ilam
longdescription: To use Kathmandu International Mountain Film Festival (KIMFF) 2010 films, being a powerful medium, to advance better sensitivity and understanding among people on contemporary issues facing Nepali society with special focus on migrant labour, biodiversity, climate change and environment, cultural diversity, gender and development priorities. KIMFF hopes not only to encourage a deeper understanding of the socio-economic, cultural, and political realities of the country but also to create a sense that the significance of these issues is shared. The growing distance and complexity of the relationship between the centre and the districts is what KIMFF seeks to narrow down. The impetus for the festival has always been the trust of the community in the capability of the audio-visual medium in creating social and economic transformation.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / PROMOTING CHILD RIGHTS THROUGH EDUCATIONAL SETTINGS
projecttitle: NGO Support / Promoting Child Rights Through Educational Settings
longdescription: The school enrolment ratio of children in Nepal is almost 87 percent, but still the drop out rate is also very high, almost 100 children enrolled in grade one only 22 percent appear the school leaving examination. Children experienced discrimination, have suffered violence on the name of discipline, are victims of political conflict and have suffered sexual abuse. The school curriculum is not childrens right responsive and friendly. The project aims to promote and protect child rights in and through educational settings and policies with the active involvement of parents, community and children themselves. The project promotes significantly schools and other educational sectors role on promoting childrens rights at local and national level and to ensure child rights in schools benefits children directly.

The project aims to improve the capacity of DHM in hydrometeorological observations, services and international data sharing and thus improve the capability of the Government of Nepal to respond to the increased risks of natural disasters related to weather and climate.
