shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / INTEGRATED RIVER BASIN MANAGEMENT AT KOSHI RIVER
projecttitle: NGO Support / Integrated river basin management at Koshi River
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti WWF Finland
geography: Nepal, Koshi River Basin (eastern Nepal), Indrawati sub-basin
longdescription: The trans-boundary Koshi basin provides freshwater for livelihoods and ecosystem services for millions of poor people in Nepal and India. Due to the pressure from anthropogenic sources and climate change the stability of the system is under threat. The project purpose is to ensure pro-poor sustainable socio-economic and environmental development in Koshi basin based on the principles of Intergrated River Basin Management. The objective is to reduce vulnerability of people, biodiversity, and economic investments in the Koshi River basin caused by climate change and human activities.

shortdescription: NGO SUPPORT / GPHRC HOSPITAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
projecttitle: NGO Support / GPHRC hospital development project
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Suomen kristillinen lkriseura ry
longdescription: To keep and provide quality of services to larger number of disabled people needing rehabilitation and medical services in western part of Nepal.

shortdescription: RURAL VILLAGE WATER RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PROJECT, SECOND PHASE
projecttitle: Rural Village Water Resources Management Project, Second Phase
purposename: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation
longdescription: The overall objective of RVWRMP is institutionalised capacity at local and regional levels to sustain and continuously improve enhanced quality of life, better environmental conditions and increased opportunities in rural livelihoods in the project area. The purpose of the phase II is to achieve improved well-being and reduced poverty in project VDCs. The new phase emphasises the impacts of the project instead of means.

shortdescription: JOINT EVALUATION OF SUPPORT TO PEACE BUILDING IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Joint evaluation of Support to Peace Building in Nepal
longdescription: Joint evaluation takes place so that Denmark is the leader of the evaluation. Participants in the joint evaluation are those donors that have supported through different channels the peace building process in Nepal. Finland is one of these donors. It has been agreed with Denmark that Finland would mount a separate outreach study on the impact of the support to the various peace building and human rights funds on the village and community level and on individual people in particular women. This separate study would be amalgamated in the actual evaluation as an input. The review would also contribute to our knowledge of Finlands suppor to the process of involving women in peace buildin.

shortdescription: NEP/FLC HNFF ALLO ENTERPRISE FOR SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS
projecttitle: NEP/FLC HNFF Allo Enterprise for Sustainable Livelihoods
longdescription: Overall objective of the project is to build an environmentally-sustainable value chain for allo from field to district-level centre for the benefit of 39 women allo producing groups in Sankhuwasabha Solukhumbu and Bhojpur Districts of Eastern Nepal.Specific objectives are to ensure sustainable supply of raw material through cultivation and management of allo on private and common lands to adopt appropriate technologies for allo extraction and spinning and to build the capacity of newly registered   cottage industry for a sustainable allo enterprise.The main avtivities are: Training materials and co-funding support for allo cultivation Testing procurement and installation of spinning machine set that is adapted for allo fibres; establishing procedures for efficient and equitable ownership and management; training local people on how to operate it Replication of environmentally-sound steaming techniques for fibre extraction to reduce fuel-wood usage and improve productivity Capacity-building of a self-supporting producer-controlled community-based cottage industry to deliver services to producer groups.Expected results of the projec are: Increase in volume of allo raw material supply by 50% as compared with benchmark through environmentally-sustainable cultivation and management of allo on private and common lands. Spinning machine set installed producing consistent quality allo yarn with corresponding reduction of unhealthy use of the drop spindle Energy-efficient extraction of allo fibre using a steaming method Producer-controlled community-based cottage industry established with operational service centre.

shortdescription: NP/FLC NGO FEDERATION OF NEPAL PROMOTING NGOS' GOVERNANCE AND MANAGEMENT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: NP/FLC NGO Federation of Nepal Promoting NGOs' Governance and Management in Nepal
longdescription: The project aims to contribute for creating democratic and credible governance and management system in NGOs/CSOs of Nepal that could be scaled up to Nepali politics and society. The overall objective of the project is to increase access and voices of people to basic services and entitlements as the rights-holders by expanding the roles of NGOs/CSOs in democratic governance and development which ultimately contribute for sustainable peace and conflict transformation in the country. The project aims to develop the capacity of NGOs/CSOs for embedding the key elements of institutional good governance which will enhance effectiveness of NGOs/CSOs in development process of Nepal. It will give a greater credibility to them for the development process they facilitate. The specific objective of the project is to improve governance and management of NGOs/CSOs for effective delivery of basic services in the country by enhancing their legitimacy transparency accountability and integrity.

shortdescription: FRAME AGREEMENT WITH NGO (FINN CHURCH AID)
projecttitle: Frame Agreement with NGO (Finn Church Aid)
longdescription: Defending Human Rights of Dalits. To create pressure on human rights community (state and non-state) for reducing abuses and violations of human rights of Dalits and to enhance access of Dalits to justice system with increased responsiveness of duty bearers towards HR issues of Dalits.

shortdescription: REGIONAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROJECT IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Regional Solid Waste Management Project in Nepal
longdescription: The purpose of the project is to establish a sustainable, regional solid waste management system in the area of Sunsari and Morang districts in Nepal. This is achieved through an institutionalised cooperation between the municipalities of the two districts providing services also to the surrounding VDCs.

shortdescription: INTEGRATING SEXUAL AND REPRODUCTIVE HEALTH AND BIODIVERSITY
projecttitle: Integrating Sexual and Reproductive Health and Biodiversity
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti, WWF Suomen Raha
geography: Districts of Dang, Chitwan, Banke, Bardiya and Kailali, Terai, Nepal
longdescription: The project implements an integrated population, health and environment (PHE) approach. The objective is improved sustainable management of natural resources and increased access to sexual and reproductive health (SRH) services contributing to improved livelihood in environmentally critical areas of Terai Arc Landscape. Income generating activities, biodiversity conservation and SRH rights and services are promoted. Food security and climate change adaptation with some mitigation activities, as well as capacities of community-based organisations are developed.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO CONSTITUTION BUILDING IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Support to Constitution building in Nepal
channelreportedname: International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance
longdescription: The project is to be implemented within the International IDEA ongoing project  Supporting Constitution Building in Nepal  by including additional outcomes and activities. The objectives are to 1) build capacity of key political actors involved in Nepal's constitution making process and 2) initiate and deepen dialogue among key political actors towards building consensus on these constitutional issues.

shortdescription: EU/MOBILIZING YOUTH FOR GENDER EQUALITY IN POLITICS
projecttitle: EU/Mobilizing Youth for Gender Equality in Politics
channelreportedname: Political Parties of Finland for Democracy (Demo Finland)
longdescription: Discrimination and unequal share of power are considered the major bottleneck for democracy in Nepal. Discrimination has restricted women and members of other marginalized groups from equal access to the state?s policy making positions. The proposed Action supports building up the pluralistic and representative democracy in Nepal by supporting cross-party forums for dialogue promote the use of non-violent activities for transformation and increase women's capacity to engage in political processes. The action is based on notion that Women's meaningful participation in political processes reinforces sustainable peace and reduces the risk of politically initiated violence and halt in democratic processes.The Joint Youth and Student Platform in Nepal with support of DEMO Finland has experience and proven strengths of challenging the status quo of political party organisations as well as together tackle difficult cultural matters in society. This project will strengthen the Platform as a cross-party dialogue centre which has the will and the know-how to promote inclusion pluralism and equal participation in political parties.The duration of the project is 29 months in 2013-2015 and the proposed funding for the project is 37 500 euros which will be used during the first year of the project .

shortdescription: ENVIRONMENT ADMINISTRATION STRENGTHENING IN LOCAL LEVEL SEAM
projecttitle: Environment administration strengthening in local level SEAM
longdescription: The project aims to strengthen environmental administration and management at the local level in the industrial corridor of Nepal. By means of environmental advocacy and the project support local population is sensitized to actively pursue for imporovements  in their sanitary and hygienic conditions. The overall aim of the project is to introduce good practices for environment management systems and pollution control.

geography: Nepal, District of Dadeldhura, Villages: Ajayameru, Samaiji, Masthamandu, Ganeshpur
longdescription: The objective of the project is to improve the quality of education and to improve access to educational facilities of primary schools in Far Western Dadeldhura District, Nepal. At school and community level beneficiaries are trained and sensitised, and school facilities improved. At district level, education sector stakeholders are sensitised and trained; special focus is on the governmental bodies. Expeced results are improved enrolment and quality of education, and improved management of the educational bodies.

shortdescription: STRENGTHENING RIGHTS AND SAFETY IN FORESTRY
projecttitle: Strengthening rights and safety in forestry
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Maailman Luonnon Sti, WWF Suomi
longdescription: The project aims at strengthening rights and safety of forest trade union members and individual wood workers, and improve the ecological values of the forests in Nepal by educating wood workers on sustainable forest management and biodiversity protection. Increased memberships of forest trade unions and safe working conditions is also an objective. Capacity of government agencies and trade unions to advocate for policies is increased to support sustainable forestry to address climate change.

shortdescription: INTEGRATING MENTAL HEALTH IN PRIMARY HEALTH CARE
projecttitle: Integrating mental health in primary health care
channelreportedname: Finnish NGO, Lkrin Sosiaalinen Vastuu ry
longdescription: Improving the quality of and the access to mental health services in Nepals Dang district. Alleviating the stigma associated with mental illness.

shortdescription: MULTI STAKEHOLDER FOREST SECTOR SUPPORT; TRANSITION PHASE
projecttitle: Multi stakeholder forest sector support; transition phase
longdescription: The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) acting through the Embassy of Switzerland has a lead role in the implementation of the Programme during 2011-2015. After the three year transition phase the programme is expected to be handed over to a national entity. The ultimate aim of the programme is to become a National Forestry Fund administered by the Government of Nepal. During the transition phase 22 districts will be covered. The programme area will eventually be extended to 61 districts in Nepal.

shortdescription: SUPPORT TO NATIONAL HUMAN RIGHTS COMMISSION OF NEPAL
projecttitle: Support to National Human Rights Commission of Nepal
channelreportedname: Recipient Government, National Human Rights Commission (NHRC)
longdescription: National Human Rights Commission, NHRC, is a central constitutional human rights body in Nepal. Commission s work focuses on monitoring transitional justice and human rights promotion. Finland with other donors has been supporting a UNDP s capacity building project. This project will further enhance the Commission s capacity especially in the fields that intertwine with other Finnish involvement, such as, investigation of human rights violations and human rights work in education sector. The project duration is 18 months during 2010-2012. The total budget is 185 000 euros.

shortdescription: SANITATION AND WATER FOR ALL IN THE CONTEXT OF CLIMATE CHANGE IN NEPAL
projecttitle: Sanitation and Water for all in the context of Climate Change in Nepal
longdescription: The UNICEF WASH-programme supports the Government of Nepal in its efforts to formulate and implement one national WASH program to achieve the national target of universal water supply and sanitation coverage  by 2017. The programme is implemented throug five components: 1)Support for capacity-building and formulation of a national WASH programme, 2) District level coordination and harmonisation and support for WASH programme interventions, 3) improved interagency coordination on WASH emergency preparedness and response, 4)Rollout of a comprehensive hygiene promotion initiative in selected diarrhoea-prone districts, 5): Scale-up of school WASH, hygiene promotion (including hand washing with soap) and community approaches to total sanitation (CATS), using children as agents of change.

shortdescription: CIVIL SOCIETY PROGRAMME FUNDING SUPPORT SCHEME - CIVIL SOCIETY - CIVIL SOCIETY PROJECT FUNDING 2012 - CSF007-1201 SUPPORT TO CIVIL SOCIETY AND-FOREST
projecttitle: CIVIL SOCIETY PROGRAMME FUNDING SUPPORT SCHEME - Civil Society - Civil Society Project Funding 2012 - CSF007-1201 SUPPORT TO CIVIL SOCIETY AND-Forest industries - -ENV-Environment
longdescription: Irish Aid has provided multi-annual programme grants to five established Irish NGOs, Christian Aid, Concern, Goal, Trcaire and Self Help Africa under the Multi Annual Programme Scheme (MAPS).  Since 2006, a significant number of additional NGOs received multi-annual block grants tied to specific projects but frequently implemented on a multi-country basis The end of the MAPS and Block Grant programmes presented an opportunity to redesign programme funding in a way which would help to address some of the weaknesses identified in the last cycle.  Lessons were documented through a mid-term review (2009), as well as monitoring, evaluation and audit.  The first step involved a clarification and rationalisation of eligibility criteria to enable a distinction between organisations with a reasonable level of capacity suited to programme funding and those more suited to project funding.

shortdescription: ASSISTANCE TO DISABLE CHILDREN. PREVENTION, AWARENESS PROGRAMS AND SPECIAL EDUCATION CENTRE FOR KIDS WITH CEREBRAL PARALYSIS.
projecttitle: Assistance to disable children. Prevention, awareness programs and Special Education Centre for kids with cerebral paralysis.
longdescription: Atencin a  infancia con discapacidad. Programas de prevencin, sensibilizacin y Centro de educacin especial para nios con parlisis cerebral. :: Proyecto de educacin especial y rehabilitacin fsica de nios discapacitados y apoyo a los padres y comunidad ofreciendo informacin y apoyo tcnico, mediante diferentes estratgias de intervencin. accso a la educacin, atencin domiciliria, sensibilizacin pblica y prevencin. 6 aos de proyecto. El proyecto tambin en collaboracin con Fisios Mundi, que facilitaran professionales  para la formacin y el asesoramiento.  El projecte est dirigit als sectors ms desfavorits de la poblaci local, nens amb discapacitat severa crnica.  Una part important del projecte s realitzar activitats de prevenci millorant l?assessorament a les dones durant l?embars i la sensibilitzaci a les famlies i comunitats. Es fa formaci i acompanyament a les mares i pares i sensibilitzaci a la comunitat. Es contemplen visites a domicili i formaci de l?entorn.Com a beneficiaris directes; 632 persones, 61 infants amb parlisis cerebrals i trastorns afins, 191 membres de la comunitat que participen en diferents programes comunitaris infants sn atesos al centre de dia i 50 al domicili en zones allunyades. Com a beneficiaris indirectes les seves famlies i entorns ms propers de la comunitat

shortdescription: PEACE-BUILDING FROM BELOW / CONSOLIDATION DE LA PAIX  PARTIR DE LA COMMUNAUT
projecttitle: Peace-Building from Below / Consolidation de la paix  partir de la communaut
longdescription: The project facilitates the mobilization, development, strengthening, and networking of community-based organizations (CBOs) and people's organizations in two districts in eastern Nepal that lack basic infrastructure, government resources, and social sector support systems. The project focuses on promoting equitable socio-economic development by empowering local people, particularly marginalized and disadvantaged groups. It aims to improve health and sanitation in rural communities by increasing livelihood and employment opportunities for women, Dalits, and other disadvantaged groups. The project includes advocating and networking for social justice, good governance, and pro-poor development. It supports democracy programming by addressing the needs of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and ex-combatants, especially women, who are returning home after years of conflict. The project is implemented by Rural Reconstruction Nepal, in partnership with local CBOs, non-governmental organizations, and relevant government agencies. / Le projet facilite la mobilisation, le dveloppement, le renforcement et le rseautage d'organismes communautaires et d'organismes populaires dans deux districts de l'est du Npal, dont l'infrastructure de base, les ressources gouvernementales et les systmes de soutien du secteur social sont dficients. Le projet vise  favoriser le dveloppement socio-conomique quitable. Il habilite la population locale, notamment les groupes marginaliss et dfavoriss,  amliorer la sant et l'assainissement dans leurs collectivits rurales en augmentant les possibilits de subsistance et d'emploi pour les femmes, les dalits (membres des basses castes) et les autres groupes dfavoriss. Le projet stimule du lobbyisme et du rseautage en faveur de la justice sociale, de la bonne gouvernance et du dveloppement favorable aux pauvres. Il appuie le dveloppement dmocratique en se penchant sur les besoins des personnes dplaces  l'intrieur de leur propre pays (PDIP) et des ex-combattants, surtout des femmes, qui rentrent chez eux aprs des annes de conflit. La mise en oeuvre est assure par Rural Reconstruction Nepal, en partenariat avec des organismes communautaires, organismes locaux non-gouvernementaux et des agences gouvernementales.

shortdescription: HUMAN RIGHTS INTERNET - INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIPS 2011-2014 / INTERNET DES DROITS HUMAINS - STAGES INTERNATIONAUX 2011-2014
projecttitle: Human Rights Internet - International Internships 2011-2014 / Internet des droits humains - Stages internationaux 2011-2014
longdescription: This project is part of CIDA's International Youth Internship Program (IYIP), funded by Canada's Youth Employment Strategy (YES). It is designed to offer young Canadian post-secondary graduates the opportunity to gain professional experience through international cooperation work. As a general rule, CIDA provides up to $15,000 per internship to Canadian organizations that manage the internships and recruit interns. / Ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (PSIJ) de l'ACDI, programme financ par la Stratgie emploi jeunesse (SEJ) du gouvernement du Canada. Le programme offre  des jeunes Canadiennes et Canadiens rcemment diplms (collge ou universit) une exprience professionnelle de travail pratique dans le domaine de la coopration internationale. L'ACDI verse normalement un maximum de 15 000 $ par stage  des organisations canadiennes qui grent les stages et recrutent les stagiaires.

shortdescription: USC CANADA - PROGRAM 2010-2015 / USC CANADA - PROGRAMME 2010-2015
projecttitle: USC Canada - Program 2010-2015 / USC Canada - Programme 2010-2015
longdescription: This program contributes to enhanced food security by: (1) significantly increasing the production of food for 15,000 households; (2) stimulating sustainable economic growth by promoting community economic activities for 7,000 households; and (3) increasing household income by an estimated 20%.   Key activities include: (1) training partner staff in monitoring and conducting baseline studies and assessments; (2) strengthening the capacity of community seed banks by creating additional seed banks, providing training in plant breeding, and control of post-harvest losses; (3) improving agricultural infrastructure for soil and water conservation, providing training on cropping methodologies and promoting agroforestry; (4) training farmers in post-harvest processing, providing training on micro-enterprises and strengthening the capacity of farmers' and women's associations; (5) undertaking gender analyses and gender audits with all USC partners to provide them with leadership training and to promote women-led agricultural production and income-generating activities for women; and (6) engaging Canadians by hosting several hundred community events across Canada, developing short videos, and producing publications related to food security. / Ce programme contribue  rehausser la scurit alimentaire : 1) en augmentant substantiellement la production d'aliments pour 15 000 foyers; 2) en stimulant une croissance conomique durable par la promotion d'activits conomiques communautaires pour 7 000 foyers; 3) en augmentant le revenu des familles d'environ 20 %.   Parmi les activits principales : 1) former le personnel du partenaire en matire de suivi et de ralisation d'tudes et d'valuations de base; 2) renforcer la capacit communautaire en matire de banques de semences en crant des banques de semences additionnelles, en fournissant une formation sur la reproduction des plantes et sur le contrle des pertes aprs les rcoltes; 3) amliorer les infrastructures agricoles en matire de conservation des sols et de l'eau en fournissant une formation sur les mthodes de culture sur terrains dfrichs et en favorisant l'agroforesterie; 4) former les fermiers en matire de procds de distribution suite aux rcoltes en fournissant une formation en micro-entreprises et en renforant la capacit des fermiers et des associations de femmes; 5) raliser des analyses et des rapports sur l'galit des sexes avec tous les partenaires de l'USC pour leur donner une formation en leadership et favoriser une production agricole mene par les femmes et des activits gnratrices de revenus pour les femmes; 6) mobiliser les Canadiens en organisant plusieurs centaines d'vnements communautaires  travers le Canada, par la prsentation de courts vidos et la distribution de dpliants sur la scurit alimentaire.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE FOR HEALTH / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET HYGINE POUR LA SANT
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for Health / Eau, assainissement et hygine pour la sant
channelreportedname: Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation Technology
longdescription: This project aims to contribute to improved maternal and child health by increasing access to improved drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene. The project is establishing eight water expertise and training centres, one in each of the selected countries, to provide training, technical consulting, and educational resources to government agencies, non-governmental organizations and community groups involved in water, sanitation and hygiene services. It is expected that 354,000 people (of which 79% women and children) have access to improved water, sanitation and hygiene. Activities include: community awareness programs on household solutions benefiting maternal, newborn and child health; and institutional capacity development in governance, performance monitoring, strategic and operational planning, and financial sustainability.   The Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) is working in partnership with Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambia); Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Haiti), Danish Committee for Aid to Afghan Refugees (Afghanistan), Centre regional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroon), Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (Ethiopia), Environment and Public Health Organization (Nepal), National Center of Environmental Health and Water Supply    Nam Saat (Laos) and CWS (Cambodia) to implement this project.   This project is part of Canada's Maternal, Newborn and Child Health commitment. / Ce projet vise  amliorer la sant des mres et des enfants en contribuant  augmenter l'accs  une meilleure eau potable, de meilleures installations sanitaires et une meilleure hygine. Huit centres d'expertise et de formation en eau sont tablis, un dans chacun des pays cibls, pour fournir une formation, des conseils techniques et des ressources en ducation aux agences gouvernementales, aux organisations non gouvernementales et aux groupes communautaires impliqus dans les services d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Il est attendu que ceci puisse bnficier  354 000 personnes, dont 79 % des femmes et des enfants, afin qu'ils aient accs  des services amliors d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Les activits comprennent des programmes de sensibilisation communautaires sur les solutions qui peuvent bnficier la sant des mres, des nouveau-ns et des enfants dans les foyers, et le dveloppement de la capacit institutionnelle en matire de gouvernance, de suivi du rendement, de planification stratgique et oprationnelle, et de viabilit financire.   Le Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) ralise ce projet en partenariat avec la Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambie), le Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Hati), le Comit danois d'aide aux rfugis afghans (Afghanistan), le Centre rgional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroun), la Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (thio

shortdescription: SAHAKARYA - BUILDING SELF-RELIANT COMMUNITIES - I / SAHAKARYA - BTIR DES COLLECTIVITS AUTONOMES - I
projecttitle: Sahakarya - Building Self-Reliant Communities - I / Sahakarya - Btir des collectivits autonomes - I
channelreportedname: CECI Centre d'tude et de coopration
longdescription: Sahakarya aims to improve socio-economic conditions of selected communities by promoting equitable and representative community-based organizations (CBOs) capable of managing local resources and interacting with locally elected bodies and government agencies.   The goal of the project is to contribute to the reduction of poverty in the hilly regions of Nepal by strengthening community-based organizations (CBOs) through economic and social development. The project is being implemented in the Mid and Far Western Districts: Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet, and Dailekh. The Canadian Executing Agency is Canadian Centre for Studies and International Cooperation (CECI) and the Social Welfare Council (SWC) is the Nepalese government counterpart. / Sahakarya a pour mission d'amliorer la situation socio-conomique de collectivits choisies en faisant la promotion d'organisations communautaires reprsentatives et quitables aptes  grer les ressources locales et  interagir avec les reprsentants des organes et des organismes gouvernementaux lus localement.   Le projet vise  rduire la pauvret dans les rgions montagneuses du Npal en renforant les organisations communautaires par le dveloppement conomique et social. Le projet est mis en oeuvre dans les districts de l'ouest et de l'extrme ouest du pays, soit Jumla, Dadeldhura, Baitadi, Surkhet et Dailekh. Le centre canadien d'tudes et de coopration internationale est l'agent d'excution canadien et le Conseil du bien-tre social, celui du gouvernement du Npal.

shortdescription: CANADA FUND FOR LOCAL INITIATIVES (CFLI) - NEPAL - 2011-2012 / FONDS CANADIEN D'INITIATIVES LOCALES (FCIL) - NPAL - 2011-2012
projecttitle: Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) - Nepal - 2011-2012 / Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) - Npal - 2011-2012
longdescription: The Canada Fund for Local Initiatives (CFLI) is designed to support small projects proposed and implemented by local organizations in Nepal. In providing funding for small projects that offer direct social, economic, or technical assistance to local populations, the CFLI contributes to the overall goal of reducing poverty.   The objective of this CFLI is to support Nepal's peace process by promoting community reconciliation and enhanced community economic opportunities. It also supports the protection and promotion of human rights. The main organizations eligible for funding are community-based organizations and national level non-governmental organizations. / Le Fonds canadien d'initiatives locales (FCIL) vise  appuyer des petits projets proposs et mis en oeuvre par des organisations locales au Npal. Les projets financs par le FCIL offrent de l'aide (sociale, conomique ou technique) directement a la population locale. Le FCIL contribue ainsi aux objectifs de rduction de la pauvret.   L'objectif de ce FCIL est d'appuyer le processus de la paix au Npal par la promotion de la rconciliation communautaire et l'amlioration des opportunits conomiques dans les collectivits. Le FCIL appuie aussi la protection et promotion des droits humains. Les principales organisations admissibles au financement du FCIL sont les organisations communautaires et les organisations non gouvernementales locales ou nationales.

L'objectif de ce FCIL est d'appuyer le processus de la paix au Npal par la promotion de la rconciliation communautaire et l'amlioration des opportunits conomiques dans les collectivits. Le FCIL appuie aussi la protection et promotion des droits humains. Les principales organisations admissibles au financement du FCIL sont les organisations communautaires et les organisations non gouvernementales locales ou nationales.

shortdescription: CANADA FUND FOR LOCAL INITIATIVES (CFLI) - NEPAL - 2010-2011 / FONDS CANADIEN D'INITIATIVES LOCALES (FCIL) - NPAL - 2010-2011

shortdescription: ENGAGING WITH THE CONSTITUENT ASSEMBLY ON CONSTITUTIONAL DEVELOPMENT / PARTICIPER  L'ASSEMBLE CONSTITUANTE SUR LA CRATION D'UNE CONSTITUTION
projecttitle: Engaging with the Constituent Assembly on Constitutional Development / Participer  l'assemble constituante sur la cration d'une constitution
longdescription: This project builds on and consolidates results achieved during the Developing Democracy in Nepal sub-project. It promotes strategic engagement between civil society organizations and Nepal's Constituent Assembly, responsible for developing the new constitution. The goal of the project is to ensure that the new constitution provides the structure for a strong and vibrant sustainable democracy that protects human rights, promotes economic development and consolidates the peace process in Nepal. The project aims to ensure that the constitution-making process is inclusive, effective and democratic, and that the constitution includes specific provisions relating to fundamental equality rights. The Canadian Bar Association implements this project in partnership with the Nepal Bar Association (NBA), helping to strengthen the NBA's capacity to support the constitution-making process and the implementation of the new constitution. Project activities include: providing advice related to constitutional implementation to the NBA and other Nepali civil society organizations; mobilizing Canadian and international volunteer legal experts; and producing research papers to inform and support recommendations for constitutional provisions relating to fundamental rights. / Ce projet exploite et consolide les rsultats qui ont t obtenus par le sous-projet 'Dveloppement de la Dmocratie au Npal'. Le projet encourage l'engagement stratgique entre les organisations de la socit civile et l'Assemble Constituante npalaise, qui est charge d'tablir une nouvelle constitution. Ce projet a pour but de s'assurer que la nouvelle constitution fournisse la structure ncessaire pour une dmocratie durable, forte et dynamique, une dmocratie qui protge les droits de la personne, qui fait la promotion du dveloppement conomique et qui consolide le processus de paix au Npal. De plus il faut que le processus d'laboration de la constitution soit inclusif, efficace et dmocratique, de manire  obtenir une constitution qui prvoit des dispositions prcises sur les droits fondamentaux en matire d'galit. L'Association du Barreau canadien met ce projet en oeuvre en collaboration avec l'Association du Barreau npalais pour aider ce dernier  renforcer sa capacit d'appuyer le processus d'tablissement de la constitution et sa mise en oeuvre. Le projet comprend les activits suivantes : fournir des conseils sur la mise en oeuvre de la constitution  l'Association du Barreau npalais et aux autres organisations de la socit civile au Npal; mobiliser des Canadiens et trangers volontaires qui sont des experts en la matire; produire des rapports de recherche afin d'tayer les recommandations en vue d'inclure des dispositions constitutionnelles sur les droits fondamentaux.

shortdescription: KNOWLEDGE-BASED POLICY AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE II / DVELOPPEMENT ET POLITIQUES FONDES SUR LE SAVOIR - II
projecttitle: Knowledge-based Policy and Program Development Initiative II / Dveloppement et politiques fondes sur le savoir - II

shortdescription: PUBLIC SECTOR POLICY AND ADM. MANAGEMENT
purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management

shortdescription: MINES ACTION CANADA - INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIPS 2011-2014 / ACTION MINES CANADA - STAGES INTERNATIONAUX 2011-2014
projecttitle: Mines Action Canada - International Internships 2011-2014 / Action Mines Canada - Stages internationaux 2011-2014
longdescription: This project is part of CIDA's International Youth Internship Program (IYIP), funded by Canada's Youth Employment Strategy (YES). It is designed to offer young Canadian post-secondary graduates the opportunity to gain professional experience through international cooperation work. As a general rule, CIDA provides up to $15,000 per internship to Canadian organizations that manage the internships and recruit interns. / Ce projet fait partie du programme de stages internationaux pour les jeunes (PSIJ) de l'ACDI, programme financ par la Stratgie emploi jeunesse (SEJ) du gouvernement du Canada. Le programme offre  des jeunes Canadiennes et Canadiens rcemment diplms (collge ou universit) une exprience professionnelle de travail pratique dans le domaine de la coopration internationale. L'ACDI verse normalement un maximum de 15 000 $ par stage  des organisations canadiennes qui grent les stages et recrutent les stagiaires.

The Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF) supports applied research projects that address food security challenges in the developing world. It is jointly funded, coordinated, and implemented in collaboration with the International Development Research Centre (IDRC) and uses the combined expertise of both organizations to maximize the impact of the projects funded. Through investments in applied research, the CIFSRF contributes to the development of more productive, sustainable, and gender-sensitive agricultural techniques for women subsistence farmers, with the ultimate goal of making food sources more secure and accessible, and the food produced more nutritious, for poor households - particularly for women and girls, who face the heaviest burden of chronic hunger and malnutrition in developing countries.   One of the objectives of the CIFSRF is to ensure that the results generated by the research funded are used to inform food security policies, programs, and on-the-ground development activities. Partnership is also an important aspect of the CIFSRF. All the research projects funded are jointly conducted by Canadian and developing country-based organizations, such as academic institutions, private sector organizations, civil society organizations, or research institutions. These partnerships harness Canada's expertise in agriculture and nutritional science and combine it with first-hand knowledge and expertise in developing countries, to maximize the benefit for development activities.   Key expected results include: 1) Increased use by research community of Canadian knowledge and resources to address agricultural productivity and nutrition problems in developing countries; 2) Increased global, national, and local knowledge of new, environmentally sustainable, and gender sensitive research applications that increase agricultural productivity and the nutritional value of food in developing countries; and 3) More informed and better developed public policies and CIDA programming related to food security in developing countries.   Early results include a more efficient and labour-saving technology for de-hulling grains, a single vaccine to protect livestock from five top tropical livestock diseases, and a fibre that can safely and easily be used at farm level, to preserve soft fruit for transport and sale in more distant markets. / Le Fonds canadien de recherche sur la scurit alimentaire internationale (FCRSAI) permet de financer des projets de recherche applique qui portent sur les problmes de scurit alimentaire dans les pays en dveloppement. Il est financ, coordonn et mis en oeuvre en collaboration avec le Centre de recherches pour le dveloppement international (CRDI), et met  profit les comptences collectives des deux pour maximiser l'impact des projets financs. Au moyen d'investissements dans la recherche applique, le FCRSAI fera la promotion de systmes agricoles plus productifs et durables auprs des petite

shortdescription: LOCAL GOVERNANCE AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM - MONITORING AND ADVISORY SUPPORT / PROGRAMME DE GOUVERNANCE LOCALE ET DE DVELOPPEMENT COMMUNAUTAI
projecttitle: Local Governance and Community Development Program - Monitoring and Advisory Support / Programme de gouvernance locale et de dveloppement communautaire - Suivi et soutien consultatif
purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: This project represents funds set aside for monitoring and evaluation of the Local Governance and Community Development Program, as well as for advisory support. For administrative reasons, sometimes the funds identified for this purpose are included in the main project budget and sometimes, as in this case, they are assigned a separate project number. / Ce projet reprsente des fonds qui sont mis de ct pour le suivi et l'valuation du Programme de gouvernance et de dveloppement communautaire ainsi qu' pour de soutien consultatif. Pour des raisons administratives, les fonds identifis  ces fins sont parfois inclus dans le budget principal du projet et parfois, comme dans le cas prsent, ils sont assigns  un numro de projet diffrent.

shortdescription: WORLD LITERACY OF CANADA - PROGRAM 2007-2011 / WORLD LITERACY OF CANADA - PROGRAMME 2007-2011
projecttitle: World Literacy of Canada - Program 2007-2011 / World Literacy of Canada - Programme 2007-2011
longdescription: The Literacy for Life program works with community partners in South Asia and Canada that emphasize literacy skills and non-formal education for women and children. The program focuses 95% of its efforts on the poorest and most under developed region of the state of Uttar Pradesh in India, 5% in Nepal.   Women are at the core of the Literacy for Life program, and it makes a concerted effort to integrate gender equality in all aspects of operations. Literacy for Life is organized around focus areas such as literacy, health awareness, social enterprise, and women's advocacy groups. / Le programme Alphabtisation pour la vie est ralis avec des partenaires communautaires en Asie du Sud et au Canada qui mettent l'accent sur l'alphabtisation et l'ducation non formelle des femmes et des enfants. Le programme investit 95 % de ses efforts dans les rgions les moins dveloppes de l'tat de l'Uttar Pradesh, en Inde, et 5 % de ses efforts au Npal.   Les femmes sont au c ur du programme Alphabtisation pour la vie, ce qui implique un effort concert afin d'intgrer l'galit entre les sexes dans tous les aspects des diffrentes oprations. Alphabtisation pour la vie est organis autour de domaines cls, tels que l'alphabtisation, la sensibilisation  la sant, l'entreprise sociale et des groupes de dfense des droits des femmes.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND SMOKELESS STOVES IN RAMECHHAP / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET POLES SANS FUME AU RAMECHHAP
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Smokeless Stoves in Ramechhap / Eau, assainissement et poles sans fume au Ramechhap
longdescription: The project aims to improve the health of poor rural populations in Ramechhap District by providing clean water, sanitation services, and low-smoke cooking technologies for 20,054 women, 16,009 children, and 3,958 men. The project helps communities build and install household toilets, gravity-flow water systems that deliver clean water year-round through public taps, toilets, and smokeless domestic cooking stoves that reduce in-house smoke emission and fuel consumption. It promotes effective use of local resources and involves community participation. The project provides materials and technical support for building low-cost water, sanitation, and cooking facilities. The local communities contribute labour and materials such as sand and gravel.   World Neighbours Canada is working in partnership with Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti to implement this project. / Le projet vise  amliorer la sant des population rurales pauvres du district de Ramechhap en fournissant de l'eau propre, des services sanitaires et des technologies de cuisson  faible gnration de fume  20 054 femmes, 16 009 enfants et 3 958 hommes. Le projet aide les collectivits  construire et  installer des toilettes rsidentielles, des rseaux d'eau  coulement par gravit pour assurer un approvisionnement en eau propre  l'anne longue  travers des robinets publics, ainsi que des poles domestiques sans fume qui servent  rduire les missions de fume dans les maisons et  rduire la consommation de combustibles. Il favorise l'utilisation efficace des ressources locales et mise sur la participation de la collectivit. Le projet fournit le matriel et le soutien technique pour la construction des installations abordables d'approvisionnement en eau, de services sanitaires et de cuisson. Les collectivits locales fournissent la main-d'oeuvre ncessaire et des matriaux tels que le sable et le gravier.   World Neighbours Canada ralise ce projet en partenariat avec Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti.

longdescription: The project aims to improve the health of poor rural populations in Ramechhap District by providing clean water, sanitation services, and low-smoke cooking technologies for 20,054 women, 16,009 children, and 3,958 men. The project helps communities build and install household toilets, gravity-flow water systems that deliver clean water year-round through public taps, toilets, and smokeless domestic cooking stoves that reduce in-house smoke emission and fuel consumption. It promotes effective use of local resources and involves community participation. The project provides materials and technical support for building low-cost water, sanitation, and cooking facilities. The local communities contribute labour and materials such as sand and gravel.   World Neighbours Canada is working in partnership with Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti to implement this project. / Le projet vise  amliorer la sant des population rurales pauvres du district de Ramechhap en fournissant de l'eau propre, des services sanitaires et des technologies de cuisson  faible gnration de fume  20 054 femmes, 16 009 enfants et 3 958 hommes. Le projet aide les collectivits  construire et  installer des toilettes rsidentielles, des rseaux d'eau  coulement par gravit pour assurer un approvisionnement en eau propre  l'anne longue  travers des robinets publics, ainsi que des poles domestiques sans fume qui servent  rduire les missions de fume dans les maisons et  rduire la consommation de combustibles. Il favorise l'utilisation efficace des ressources locales et mise sur la participation de la collectivit. Le projet fournit le matriel et le soutien technique pour la construction des installations abordables d'approvisionnement en eau, de services sanitaires et de cuisson. Les collectivits locales fournissent la main-d'oeuvre ncessaire et des matriaux tels que le sable et le gravier.   World Neighbours Canada ralise ce projet en partenariat avec Tamakoshi Sewa Samiti.

shortdescription: USC CANADA - PROGRAM 2010-2015 / USC CANADA - PROGRAMME 2010-2015
projecttitle: USC Canada - Program 2010-2015 / USC Canada - Programme 2010-2015
longdescription: This program contributes to enhanced food security by: (1) significantly increasing the production of food for 15,000 households; (2) stimulating sustainable economic growth by promoting community economic activities for 7,000 households; and (3) increasing household income by an estimated 20%.   Key activities include: (1) training partner staff in monitoring and conducting baseline studies and assessments; (2) strengthening the capacity of community seed banks by creating additional seed banks, providing training in plant breeding, and control of post-harvest losses; (3) improving agricultural infrastructure for soil and water conservation, providing training on cropping methodologies and promoting agroforestry; (4) training farmers in post-harvest processing, providing training on micro-enterprises and strengthening the capacity of farmers' and women's associations; (5) undertaking gender analyses and gender audits with all USC partners to provide them with leadership training and to promote women-led agricultural production and income-generating activities for women; and (6) engaging Canadians by hosting several hundred community events across Canada, developing short videos, and producing publications related to food security. / Ce programme contribue  rehausser la scurit alimentaire : 1) en augmentant substantiellement la production d'aliments pour 15 000 foyers; 2) en stimulant une croissance conomique durable par la promotion d'activits conomiques communautaires pour 7 000 foyers; 3) en augmentant le revenu des familles d'environ 20 %.   Parmi les activits principales : 1) former le personnel du partenaire en matire de suivi et de ralisation d'tudes et d'valuations de base; 2) renforcer la capacit communautaire en matire de banques de semences en crant des banques de semences additionnelles, en fournissant une formation sur la reproduction des plantes et sur le contrle des pertes aprs les rcoltes; 3) amliorer les infrastructures agricoles en matire de conservation des sols et de l'eau en fournissant une formation sur les mthodes de culture sur terrains dfrichs et en favorisant l'agroforesterie; 4) former les fermiers en matire de procds de distribution suite aux rcoltes en fournissant une formation en micro-entreprises et en renforant la capacit des fermiers et des associations de femmes; 5) raliser des analyses et des rapports sur l'galit des sexes avec tous les partenaires de l'USC pour leur donner une formation en leadership et favoriser une production agricole mene par les femmes et des activits gnratrices de revenus pour les femmes; 6) mobiliser les Canadiens en organisant plusieurs centaines d'vnements communautaires  travers le Canada, par la prsentation de courts vidos et la distribution de dpliants sur la scurit alimentaire.

shortdescription: SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOODS THROUGH CO-OPERATIVES / MOYENS DE SUBSISTANCE DURABLES GRCE AUX COOPRATIVES
projecttitle: Sustainable Livelihoods Through Co-operatives / Moyens de subsistance durables grce aux coopratives
longdescription: The program aims to promote the cooperative model to support economic growth and improve food security in communities.   The expected results are: (1) Viable co-operatives provide timely, relevant and gender-sensitive programs and services to members; (2) Government decision-makers are influenced by co-operative sector; (3) Increased social and economic empowerment of women and men; and (4) Effective participation of Canadians in promoting gender equitable sustainable economic and social growth in participating countries.   These results are expected to contribute to strengthening specific areas of expertise, including human resource development, governance training, business planning, marketing training, and technical assistance. / Ce programme vise  faire la promotion du modle coopratif afin d'appuyer la croissance conomique et d'amliorer la scurit alimentaire dans les communauts.   Les rsultats anticips sont : 1) Des coopratives viables fournissent  leurs membres des programmes et des services ponctuels, pertinents, et qui tiennent compte des carts entre les hommes et les femmes ; 2) Les dcideurs du gouvernement sont influencs par le secteur coopratif ; 3) Renforcement de l'autonomie sociale et conomique des femmes et des hommes ; 4) Participation efficace des Canadiens dans la promotion d'une croissance conomique et sociale durable et plus quitable pour les femmes dans les pays viss.   Il est attendu que ces rsultats contribuent au renforcement des secteurs d'expertises spcifiques, y compris le dveloppement des ressources humaines, la formation en gouvernance, la planification des affaires, la formation en marketing, et de l'assistance technique.

shortdescription: DEVELOPING DEMOCRACY IN NEPAL (DDN) - RESPONSIVE FACILITY - CANADA / INSTAURER LA DMOCRATIE AU NPAL - MCANISME RACTIF - CANADA
projecttitle: Developing Democracy in Nepal (DDN) - Responsive Facility - Canada / Instaurer la dmocratie au Npal - Mcanisme ractif - Canada
longdescription: The project supports the Government of Nepal in its movement towards democracy with specific initiatives that enable the population to actively participate in the upcoming election of a Constituent Assembly and the drafting of a new Constitution. The project is being implemented by three Canadian organizations and is focusing on three key areas: civic education, local conflict resolution, and media training. The initiative aims to provide greater and improved access to information, understanding of rights surrounding the election, and increased ability of Nepalis to participate in informed debate related to the elections. / Le projet appuie le gouvernement du Npal dans le cadre des efforts qu'il dploie en faveur de la dmocratie, au moyen d'initiatives prcises permettant  la population de jouer un rle actif  l'gard de l'lection prochaine d'une assemble constituante et de la rdaction d'une nouvelle constitution. La mise en oeuvre est assure par trois organisations canadiennes et le project est ax sur trois secteurs cls, soit : l'ducation civique, le rglement local des conflits et la formation dans le domaine des mdias. Le projet vise  fournir un accs amlior et plus large  l'information,  mieux faire comprendre les droits lis  l'lection ainsi qu' renforcer la capacit des Npalais  prendre part  un dbat inform portant sur l'lection.

shortdescription: COUNTRY-SPECIFIC FUNDING - UNHCR 2012 / FINANCEMENT VISANT DES PAYS EN PARTICULIER - UNHCR 2012
projecttitle: Country-Specific Funding - UNHCR 2012 / Financement visant des pays en particulier - UNHCR 2012
channelname: United Nations Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
channelreportedname: UNHCR - United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees
longdescription: With CIDA support, the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) is working to protect and assist refugees, internally displaced persons and those who are stateless, while searching for lasting solutions to their plight. These funds will contribute to operations in: Bangladesh, Burma, Chad, the Democratic Republic of Congo, Haiti, Iraq, Nepal, Pakistan, Philippines, South Sudan, Sri Lanka, Sudan and Yemen.   Main activities include: providing shelter, clothing and other essential non-food items to people of concern; providing adequate sanitation services; working with governments to register asylum seekers and refugees and to help issue identity documents; working to uphold the social and economic standing of persons of concern; and working with governments to support refugee self-reliance and forge peaceful relations between refugees and local citizens. / Grce au soutien de l'ACDI, le Haut Commissariat des Nations Unies pour les rfugis (HCR) s'emploie  protger et  aider les rfugis, les personnes dplaces  l'intrieur de leur pays et les apatrides, tout en cherchant des solutions durables  leurs graves problmes. Les fonds octroys contribueront  appuyer les oprations dans les pays suivants : Bangladesh, Birmanie, Hati, Irak, Npal, Pakistan, Philippines, Rpublique dmocratique du Congo, Rpublique du Soudan du Sud, Sri Lanka, Soudan, Tchad et Ymen.   Les activits incluent: fournir des abris, des vtements et d'autres articles non alimentaires essentiels aux personnes relevant de la comptence du HCR; fournir des services d'assainissement adquats; collaborer avec les gouvernements pour inscrire les demandeurs d'asile et les rfugis et aider  la dlivrance de pices d'identit; prendre des mesures pour permettre aux personnes relevant de la comptence du HCR de maintenir leur situation sociale et conomique; collaborer avec les gouvernements pour favoriser l'autonomie des rfugis et l'tablissement de relations pacifiques entre les rfugis et les populations locales.

shortdescription: REDUCING UNEMPLOYMENT AMONG PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES / RDUIRE LE CHMAGE CHEZ LES PERSONNES HANDICAPES
projecttitle: Reducing Unemployment Among People with Disabilities / Rduire le chmage chez les personnes handicapes
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
channelreportedname: York University Centre for International and
geography: Dhaka, Bangladesh; Hyderabad, India; and Kathmandu, Nepal
longdescription: This project aims to help 10,000 women and men with disabilities to find sustainable employment and increase their household incomes. The project seeks to identify and address the key causes of chronic unemployment, underemployment, and poverty of women and men with disabilities in Dhaka, Bangladesh; Hyderabad, India; and Kathmandu, Nepal. It focuses on three sectors that employ a proportionally large number of people with disabilities: cottage or home-based industries, the hospitality sector, and food processing. The project seeks to influence small and medium enterprises to hire and promote people with disabilities, as well as increase the employability of persones with disabilities. It supports 300 employers in offering work placements for people with disabilities, thereby providing positive models for other employers in the target countries. / Le projet vise  aider 10 000 hommes et femmes handicaps  trouver des emplois durables et  accrotre le revenu de leur mnage. Le projet s'attaque aux principales causes du chmage chronique, du sous-emploi et de la pauvret des femmes et des hommes handicaps vivant  Dhaka (au Bangladesh),  Hyderabad (en Inde) et  Katmandu (au Npal). Le projet cible trois secteurs qui emploient une grande proportion de personnes handicapes : les industries artisanales et  domicile, le secteur de l'htellerie et de la transformation alimentaire. Le projet vise  inciter les petites et moyennes entreprises  embaucher et  faire la promotion des personnes handicapes et  changer l'attitude des personnes handicapes  l'gard du march du travail. Le projet aide 300 employeurs  offrir des placements en milieu de travail aux personnes handicapes, crant ainsi autant de modles positifs pour les autres employeurs des pays cibls.

shortdescription: FOREST CARBON PARTNERSHIP FACILITY - CARBON FUND / FONDS DE PARTENARIAT POUR LE CARBONE FORESTIER - FONDS CARBONE
projecttitle: Forest Carbon Partnership Facility - Carbon Fund / Fonds de partenariat pour le carbone forestier - Fonds carbone
longdescription: This project represents CIDA's contribution to the Forest Carbon Partnership Facility's (FCPF) Carbon Fund. The FCPF is a World Bank-managed global partnership that assists developing countries in tropical and sub-tropical regions in their efforts to reduce greenhouse gas emissions from deforestation and forest degradation. It promotes forest conservation, sustainable management of forests and the enhancement of forest carbon stocks (amount of carbon stored in forest ecosystems). The Carbon Fund offers financial incentives to developing countries that implement emission reduction programs to reduce the rate of deforestation and forest degradation within their country. / Ce projet reprsente l'appui de l'Agence canadienne de dveloppement international au Fonds de carbone du Fonds de partenariat pour le carbone forestier (FCPF). Le FCPF est un partenariat mondial gr par la Banque mondiale qui a pour but de soutenir les efforts dploys par les pays en dveloppement pour rduire les missions de gaz  effet de serre dcoulant de la dforestation et de la dgradation des forts. Il appuie galement la conservation et la gestion durable des forts ainsi que le renforcement de stocks de carbone forestier (quantit de carbone stock dans les cosystmes forestiers) des pays en dveloppement des rgions tropicales et subtropicales. Le Fonds de carbone offre des incitatifs financiers aux pays en dveloppement qui mettent en oeuvre des programmes de rduction des missions pour rduire le rythme de la dforestation et de la dgradation des forts dans leur pays.

shortdescription: WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME SCHOOL FEEDING PROGRAM 2012-2013 / PROGRAMME DES CANTINES SCOLAIRES DU PROGRAMME ALIMENTAIRE MONDIAL 2012-2013
projecttitle: World Food Programme School Feeding Program 2012-2013 / Programme des cantines scolaires du Programme alimentaire mondial 2012-2013
longdescription: This project is one of a number of CIDA contributions to the World Food Programme's (WFP) school feeding program. Over the past four decades, WFP has become the world's foremost provider of school meals to poor children. In addition to providing free midday meals, WFP provides students with take-home rations for the family, which encourages parents to send their boys and girls to class. School feeding initiatives target the most food-insecure areas of countries with low school enrolment, irregular school attendance, and high primary school drop-out rates.   CIDA's support to WFP's school feeding program is used to purchase, deliver and distribute nutritious food primarily to school children, particularly girls, as a means of increasing enrolment and attendance rates, decreasing drop-out rates, as well as improving children's concentration, learning and academic performance. / Ce projet fait partie d'une srie de contributions de l'ACDI au programme des cantines scolaires du Programme alimentaire mondial (PAM). Au cours des quarante dernires annes, le PAM est devenu le premier distributeur mondial de repas scolaires aux enfants pauvres. En plus des repas de midi gratuits, le PAM fournit galement des rations  rapporter  la maison, ce qui contribue  convaincre les parents d'envoyer leurs fils et leurs filles en classe. Ce programme cible les rgions les plus prcaires en termes de scurit alimentaire, dans des pays affichant un faible effectif scolaire, une frquentation irrgulire et des taux levs d'abandon au niveau primaire.   L'appui de l'ACDI au programme du PAM contribue  l'achat,  la livraison et  la distribution d'aliments nutritifs  des coliers, et surtout  des colires, dans le but d'accrotre le nombre d'inscriptions et le taux de frquentation, de rduire le taux d'abandon ainsi que d'amliorer la concentration des enfants, leur apprentissage et leurs rsultats scolaires.

shortdescription: EMERGENCY FOOD SUPPORT IN ASIA AND THE MIDDLE EAST - WORLD FOOD PROGRAMME 2012 / AIDE ALIMENTAIRE D'URGENCE EN ASIE ET AU MOYEN-ORIENT - PROGRAMME ALI
projecttitle: Emergency Food Support in Asia and the Middle East - World Food Programme 2012 / Aide alimentaire d'urgence en Asie et au Moyen-Orient - Programme alimentaire mondial 2012
longdescription: February 2012 - Established in 1961, the World Food Programme (WFP) is the food assistance arm of the United Nations, and is the largest humanitarian organization fighting hunger in the world. WFP provides food assistance to vulnerable populations as a means of addressing hunger and global food insecurity. WFP has demonstrated knowledge and capacity to address the urgent food needs of vulnerable populations, and contribute to fighting global hunger. Given WFP's presence and capacity, there are no other agencies that are able to perform the same functions on a similar scale as WFP.   Decided on the basis of need, CIDA funding is supporting WFP food assistance operations in various countries in Asia and the Middle East in 2012. WFP's main programming areas in humanitarian contexts the provision of food assistance to address acute malnutrition and food insecurity, and to protect livelihoods. / Fvrier 2012    Cr en 1961, le Programme alimentaire mondial (PAM) est l'organisme des Nations Unies responsable de l'assistance alimentaire, et est aussi la plus grande organisation humanitaire de lutte contre la faim dans le monde. Le PAM fournit une assistance alimentaire aux populations vulnrables afin de lutter contre la faim et d'amliorer la scurit alimentaire. Le PAM a dmontr les connaissances et les capacits voulues pour rpondre aux besoins d'assistance alimentaire d'urgence des populations vulnrables et contribuer  la lutte contre la faim dans le monde. Compte tenu de la prsence et des capacits du PAM, aucune autre organisation n'est en mesure d'exercer les mmes fonctions  une telle chelle.   Fourni en fonction des besoins, le financement de l'ACDI soutient les programmes d'assistance alimentaire du PAM mis en oeuvre dans divers pays d'Asie et du Moyen-Orient en 2012. Dans des contextes de crise humanitaire, le PAM concentre sa programmation sur l'apport d'une assistance alimentaire pour remdier aux situations de malnutrition aigu et d'inscurit alimentaire et protger les moyens de subsistance.

shortdescription: WUSC-CECI (UNITERRA) - VOLUNTEER SENDING 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (UNITERRA) - ENVOI DE VOLONTAIRES 2009-2014
projecttitle: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
longdescription: The Uniterra international voluntary program aims to contribute to poverty reduction and sustainable development through national and regional sectoral approaches in 13 developing countries with the support of 1,950 volunteers. The Uniterra program focuses on strengthening the capacity of 225 key organizations that work in private sector development, governance, health, and education. More specifically, the program focuses on improving access to health and education services, markets, and political participation; fostering equality between women and men; engaging organizations in political dialogue in specific sectoral issues; and raising awareness among Canadians of national, regional, and global issues with regards to private sector development, governance, health, education, and equality between women and men.   The Uniterra program is jointly operated by the Centre for International Studies and Cooperation (CECI) and World University Services of Canada (WUSC). / Le programme de volontariat international Uniterra vise  contribuer par des approches sectorielles nationales et rgionales  la rduction de la pauvret et au dveloppement durable dans 13 pays en dveloppement avec l'appui de 1 950 volontaires. Le programme Uniterra est ax sur le renforcement des capacits de 225 organisations cls du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant et de l'ducation. Plus particulirement, il vise  : amliorer l'accs aux services de sant et d'ducaion, aux marchs et  la participation politique; favoriser l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes; engager les organisations dans le dialogue sur les politiques en lien avec les enjeux de leur secteur; sensibiliser les Canadiens et les Canadiennes aux enjeux nationaux, rgionaux et mondiaux autour du secteur priv, de la gouvernance, de la sant, de l'ducation et de l'galit entre les femmes et les hommes.   Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'tude et de coopration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

Le programme Uniterra est mis en oeuvre conjointement par le Centre d'tude et de coopration internationale (CECI) et Entraide universitaire mondiale du Canada (EUMC).

projecttitle: WUSC-CECI (Uniterra) - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / EUMC-CECI (Uniterra) - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014

shortdescription: SEVA CANADA SOCIETY PROGRAM 2011-2016 / PROGRAMME SEVA CANADA SOCIETY 2011-2016
projecttitle: Seva Canada Society Program 2011-2016 / Programme Seva Canada Society 2011-2016
longdescription: The primary focus of Seva's program is to strengthen community ophthalmology, especially the identification and treatment of people needing cataract surgery. Program components include strengthening institutional training, research, knowledge transfer and monitoring capabilities, reducing gender inequalities in access to eye care and meeting the specific needs of children. Public engagement activities in Canada regarding blindness issues are a component of this program. / Le programme de Seva se concentre principalement sur le renforcement des services ophtalmologiques communautaires, en particulier dans l'indentification et le traitement de personnes qui ont besoin de chirurgie pour les cataractes. Les lments du programme comprennent le renforcement de la formation institutionnelle, la recherche, le transfert des connaissances et le suivi des capacits, tout en rduisant l'ingalit d'accs aux soins des yeux pour les hommes et les femmes et en rpondant aux besoins particuliers des enfants. Des activits d'engagement du public au Canada en ce qui a trait aux enjeux lis  la ccit font galement partie de ce programme.

shortdescription: WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE FOR HEALTH / EAU, ASSAINISSEMENT ET HYGINE POUR LA SANT
projecttitle: Water, Sanitation and Hygiene for Health / Eau, assainissement et hygine pour la sant
channelreportedname: Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation Technology
longdescription: This project aims to contribute to improved maternal and child health by increasing access to improved drinking water, sanitation, and hygiene. The project is establishing eight water expertise and training centres, one in each of the selected countries, to provide training, technical consulting, and educational resources to government agencies, non-governmental organizations and community groups involved in water, sanitation and hygiene services. It is expected that 354,000 people (of which 79% women and children) have access to improved water, sanitation and hygiene. Activities include: community awareness programs on household solutions benefiting maternal, newborn and child health; and institutional capacity development in governance, performance monitoring, strategic and operational planning, and financial sustainability.   The Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) is working in partnership with Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambia); Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Haiti), Danish Committee for Aid to Afghan Refugees (Afghanistan), Centre regional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroon), Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (Ethiopia), Environment and Public Health Organization (Nepal), National Center of Environmental Health and Water Supply    Nam Saat (Laos) and CWS (Cambodia) to implement this project.   This project is part of Canada's Maternal, Newborn and Child Health commitment. / Ce projet vise  amliorer la sant des mres et des enfants en contribuant  augmenter l'accs  une meilleure eau potable, de meilleures installations sanitaires et une meilleure hygine. Huit centres d'expertise et de formation en eau sont tablis, un dans chacun des pays cibls, pour fournir une formation, des conseils techniques et des ressources en ducation aux agences gouvernementales, aux organisations non gouvernementales et aux groupes communautaires impliqus dans les services d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Il est attendu que ceci puisse bnficier  354 000 personnes, dont 79 % des femmes et des enfants, afin qu'ils aient accs  des services amliors d'approvisionnement en eau, d'installations sanitaires et d'hygine. Les activits comprennent des programmes de sensibilisation communautaires sur les solutions qui peuvent bnficier la sant des mres, des nouveau-ns et des enfants dans les foyers, et le dveloppement de la capacit institutionnelle en matire de gouvernance, de suivi du rendement, de planification stratgique et oprationnelle, et de viabilit financire.   Le Centre for Affordable Water and Sanitation (CAWST) ralise ce projet en partenariat avec la Seeds of Hope International Partnerships (Zambie), le Programme d'appui aux initiatives de dveloppement humain (Hati), le Comit danois d'aide aux rfugis afghans (Afghanistan), le Centre rgional pour l'eau potable et l'assainissement (Cameroun), la Ethiopian Kale Heywet Church (thio

shortdescription: LOCAL GOVERNANCE AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM / PROGRAMME DE GOUVERNANCE LOCALE ET DE DVELOPPEMENT COMMUNAUTAIRE
projecttitle: Local Governance and Community Development Program / Programme de gouvernance locale et de dveloppement communautaire
purposename: Public sector policy and adm. management
longdescription: The project goal is to contribute to poverty reduction and economic growth through inclusive, responsible and accountable local governance and participatory community-led development. The program purpose is to improve access to locally and inclusively prioritised public goods and services. This is being achieved by investing in rural development, mobilizing local resources and involving communities in local development and planning.   Activities being supported include building roads, irrigation systems and electrification systems which aim to reach all 3,915 villages in Nepal. The Local Governance and Community Development Program (LGCDP) is a national multi-donor program, being implemented by the Government of Nepal's Ministry of Local Development. / Le projet vise  contribuer  la rduction de la pauvret et  la croissance conomique par une gouvernance locale inclusive et responsable, et par le dveloppement men par les communauts. Le but est d'amliorer l'acces aux biens et aux services publics localement et inclusivement prioriss. Ceci est ralis en investissant dans le dveloppement rural, en mobilisant des ressources locales et en impliquant les communauts dans le dveloppement local et la planification.   Les activits comprennent la construction de routes, de systmes d'irrigation et de d'lectrification qui visent  atteindre tous les 3915 villages au Npal. Le Programme de gouvernance locale et de dveloppement communautaire (PGLDC) est un programme national, multidonateurs, mis en oeuvre par le ministre du Dveloppement local du gouvernment du Npal.

shortdescription: SHIFTING CULTIVATION : PROMOTING INNOVATIVE POLICY AND DEVELOPMENT OPTIONS IN THE EASTERN HIMALAYAS
projecttitle: Shifting Cultivation : Promoting Innovative Policy and Development Options in the Eastern Himalayas
channelreportedname: International Centre for Integrated Mountain Development
longdescription: Shifting cultivation has generally been subject to policies that are geared toward eradicating the system altogether, whether by banning the practice or inducing farmers to take up alternative employment. This project builds on a series of experiences with shifting cultivation in India, Nepal and Bhutan that challenge the prevailing view among policymakers and forestry officials that shifting cultivation is unsustainable and destructive to forests and wildlife. The project is based on the hypothesis that shifting cultivation, if improved and rationalized as an agroforestry system, has high potential for poverty alleviation, food security and biodiversity conservation. Researchers will take a pragmatic approach to dealing with the livelihood issues of the cultivators and the health of the ecosystem, and assess the effects of increasing population pressure and market forces. The idea is to share good policies and practices related to shifting cultivation and alternative options through regional exchange.

shortdescription: INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT TO SOUTH ASIAN POLICY RESEARCH ORGANIZATIONS
projecttitle: Institutional Support to South Asian Policy Research Organizations
longdescription: IDRC's Think Tank Initiative is a multi-donor program dedicated to strengthening independent policy research institutions (think tanks) in developing countries, thereby enabling them to produce sound research that both informs and influences policy. The Initiative selected the first cohort of 24 grantees in East and West Africa through a competitive call in 2008. A second competitive call was launched in 2009, targeting seven countries in Latin America and five countries in South Asia (Bangladesh, India, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka). Of the 16 successful applicants from South Asia, nine are in India.There are very few policy research organizations in South Asia outside India. Those that exist are fragile due to little demand for policy research, limited if no funding from local sources, and an often insecure political climate. This grant will strengthen the ability of the seven selected research institutions in Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka to provide, disseminate and communicate high-quality research. This will be achieved through measures aimed at enhancing the ability of staff to conduct sound research, improving organizational performance, and forging links with policymakers. Particular effort will be made to enable grantees to mobilize other sources of funding, so that none become dependent on the Think Tank Initiative over the long term. The project will also support a platform for grantee networking both within the Initiative and with a wider network of institutions engaged in policy-related research.

shortdescription: INSTITUTIONAL SUPPORT TO SOUTH ASIAN POLICY RESEARCH ORGANIZATIONS
projecttitle: Institutional Support to South Asian Policy Research Organizations
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

shortdescription: WATER SECURITY IN PERIURBAN SOUTH ASIA : ADAPTING TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND URBANIZATION
projecttitle: Water Security in Periurban South Asia : Adapting to Climate Change and Urbanization
longdescription: According to the United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-HABITAT), 60% of the world's population will reside in urban areas by the year 2025. The urban hinterlands or periurban areas are also expected to experience considerable growth. Widely defined as transition zones, where the line between urban and rural is blurred, periurban areas have distinctive but largely under-researched social, economic and institutional characteristics. Little effort has been made to understand the implications of land acquisition for urban development on access to water by low-income or poor residents. In addition, climate change is expected to alter water availability, creating new patterns of vulnerability.In this project, researchers will use both quantitative and qualitative methods to shed light on the implications of water stress for vulnerable communities in periurban locations in four South Asian cities: New Delhi and Hyderabad (India); Kathmandu (Nepal); and Kulna (Bangladesh). These four environments face similar patterns of environmental, social and economic change and, as such, lend themselves to comparative analysis. Project outputs will include scoping studies for each of the four sites; policy briefs in English and local languages, articles in peer-reviewed journals, and an edited book. Consultative workshops with key stakeholders will be held throughout the various stages of the project, with a view to designing inclusive and sustainable urban policies and governance mechanisms.

shortdescription: WATER SECURITY IN PERIURBAN SOUTH ASIA : ADAPTING TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND URBANIZATION
projecttitle: Water Security in Periurban South Asia : Adapting to Climate Change and Urbanization
channelname: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank
channelreportedname: Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology, Dhaka
